{{about|the IRT Broadway–Seventh Avenue Line station|the IND Eighth Avenue Line station|34th Street–Penn Station (IND Eighth Avenue Line)|other uses|34th Street station (disambiguation){{!}}34th Street station}} {{Infobox NYCS | name = 34 Street–Penn Station | image = NYC subway Pennsylvania Pano.JPG | image_caption = Northbound local platform | accessible = yes | wifi = yes | address = West 34th Street & Seventh Avenue
New York, NY 10001 | borough = [[Manhattan]] | locale = [[midtown, Manhattan|Midtown]] | coordinates = {{coord|40.751|N|73.991|W|display=inline,title}} | lat_dir = N | lon_dir = W | bg_color = #E20F00 | division = IRT | line = [[IRT Broadway–Seventh Avenue Line]] | service = Broadway-Seventh center south | connection = {{bus icon}} '''[[NYCT Bus]]''': {{NYC bus link|M4|M7|M20|M34 SBS|M34A SBS|Q32}},
{{bus icon}} '''[[MTA Bus]]''': {{NYC bus link|BxM2}}
[[File:BSicon BAHN.svg|12px|alt=Railway transportation]] '''[[Amtrak]]''', '''[[Long Island Rail Road|LIRR]]''', '''[[NJT Rail]]''' (at [[Pennsylvania Station (New York City)|Penn Station]]) | open_date = {{start date and age|1917|06|03}}{{cite news| newspaper=New York Times| title=Three New Links of the Dual Subway System Opened| date=June 3, 1917| page=33}} | platforms = 2 [[side platform]]s (local)
1 [[island platform]] (express) | tracks = 4 | structure = Underground | passengers = 26,034,238{{NYCS const|riderref}} | pass_year = 2017 | pass_percent = -6.2 | rank = 6 | next_north = {{NYCS next | station=Times Square–42nd Street | line=IRT Broadway–Seventh Avenue Line | service=Broadway-Seventh center south}} | next_south = {{NYCS next | type=local | line=IRT Broadway–Seventh Avenue Line | station=28th Street | service=Broadway-Seventh center south local}}
{{NYCS next | type=express | line=IRT Broadway–Seventh Avenue Line | station=14th Street | service=Broadway-Seventh center south express}} | next_north_acc = {{NYCS next | station=Times Square–42nd Street | line=IRT Broadway–Seventh Avenue Line | service=Broadway-Seventh center south}} | next_south_acc = {{NYCS next|terminal=none|service=14th IRT terminal}}
{{NYCS next | line=IRT Broadway–Seventh Avenue Line | station=Chambers Street | service=Broadway-Seventh south}} | code = 318 | legend = {{NYCS infobox legend|alltimes}}{{NYCS infobox legend|nightsonly}}{{NYCS infobox legend|allexceptweekdaynights}}{{NYCS infobox legend|nightsweekends}}{{NYCS infobox legend|weekdaysonly}}{{NYCS infobox legend|weekendsnights}} }} '''34th Street–Penn Station''' is an express [[metro station|station]] on the [[IRT Broadway–Seventh Avenue Line]] of the [[New York City Subway]]. Located at the intersection of [[34th Street (Manhattan)|34th Street]] and [[Seventh Avenue (Manhattan)|Seventh Avenue]], it is served by the '''[[1 (New York City Subway service)|1]]''' and '''[[2 (New York City Subway service)|2]]''' trains at all times, and the '''[[3 (New York City Subway service)|3]]''' train at all times except late nights on weekdays. Connections are available to the [[Long Island Rail Road|LIRR]], [[New Jersey Transit|NJ Transit]] and [[Amtrak]] at [[Pennsylvania Station (New York City)|Pennsylvania Station]]. ==History== {{stack|float=right| {{Routemap |title=Track layout |title-bg=#{{NYCS color|Seventh}} |legend =track |map= numN330 uvSTR!~MFADEg\uvSTR!~MFADEg\udSTR!~dMFADEg ~~ ~~ ~~ to [[Times Square–42nd Street (IRT Broadway–Seventh Avenue Line)|Times Sq–42 St]] uvSTRf\udSTR\uvSTRg udSHI2g+l\udSHI2gr+l\udSHI2lr\udSHI2gl+r\udSHI2g+r dBSl\uvSTR\dBS\uvSTR\dBSr dBSl\uvSTR\dBS\uvSTR\dBSr dBSl\uvSTR\dBS\uvSTR\dBSr dBSl\uvSTR\dBS\uvSTR\dBSr uSHI1c1\uvSHI1+r\uvSHI1+l\uSHI1c4 uvSTRf\uvSTRg udSTR!~dMFADEf\uvSTR\udSTR!~dMFADEf ~~ ~~ ~~ to [[28th Street (IRT Broadway–Seventh Avenue Line)|28 St]] uvSTR!~MFADEf ~~ ~~ ~~ to [[14th Street (IRT Broadway–Seventh Avenue Line)|14 St]] }} }} 34th Street–Penn Station on the IRT Broadway–Seventh Avenue Line was opened on June 3, 1917, as part of an extension of the [[Interborough Rapid Transit Company]], the dominant subway in [[Manhattan]] at the time, from Times Square–42nd Street to [[South Ferry loops (IRT Broadway–Seventh Avenue Line)|South Ferry]]. It was served by a shuttle train to Times Square until the rest of the extension opened a year later on July 1, 1918.{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/1918/07/02/archives/open-new-subway-to-regular-traffic-first-train-on-seventh-avenue.html| title=Open new subway to regular traffic| newspaper=New York Times| accessdate=August 27, 2008}} This meant that the subway would be expanded down the Lower West Side to neighborhoods such as [[Greenwich Village]] and the western portion of the [[Financial District, Manhattan|Financial District]]. As part of this and the northern [[IRT Lexington Avenue Line]] extension, the IRT network would be radically changed from an S-shaped line connecting the eastern side of Lower Manhattan to the [[Upper West Side]] to an H-shaped network with two parallel lines, the East and West Side Lines, and a [[42nd Street Shuttle|shuttle at 42nd Street]] connecting them.{{cite news| url=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1918/08/02/97011929.pdf| title=Open new subway lines to traffic; called a triumph| newspaper=New York Times| accessdate=August 27, 2008}} Under the 2015–2019 [[Metropolitan Transportation Authority|MTA]] Capital Plan, the station, along with thirty-two other New York City Subway stations, will undergo a complete overhaul as part of the [[Enhanced Station Initiative]]. Updates would include cellular service, Wi-Fi, charging stations, improved signage, and improved station lighting. Unlike other stations that will be renovated under the initiative, 34th Street–Penn Station will not be completely closed during construction.{{cite web|url=http://web.mta.info/nyct/procure/contracts/143675sol-3.pdf|title=Enhanced Station Initiative: CCM Pre-Proposal Conference|date=October 25, 2016|website=|publisher=[[Metropolitan Transportation Authority]]|access-date=August 11, 2017|page=8 (PDF page 15)}} In January 2018, the NYCT and Bus Committee recommended that Judlau Contracting receive the $125 million contract for the renovations of [[57th Street (IND Sixth Avenue Line)|57th]] and [[23rd Street (IND Sixth Avenue Line)|23rd Street]]s on the [[IND Sixth Avenue Line]]; [[28th Street (IRT Lexington Avenue Line)|28th Street]] on the [[IRT Lexington Avenue Line]], and 34th Street–Penn Station on the IRT Broadway–Seventh Avenue Line and [[34th Street–Penn Station (IND Eighth Avenue Line)|IND Eighth Avenue Line]].{{Cite web|url=http://web.mta.info/mta/news/books/pdf/180122_1030_Transit.pdf|title=NYCT/Bus Committee Meeting|author=[[Metropolitan Transportation Authority]]|date=January 22, 2018|page=135|accessdate=January 19, 2018}} However, the MTA Board temporarily deferred the vote for these packages after city representatives refused to vote to award the contracts.{{Cite news|url=https://www.amny.com/transit/subway-station-improvements-1.16331101|title=Controversial cosmetic subway improvement plan falters|last=Barone|first=Vincent|date=January 24, 2018|work=am New York|access-date=2018-01-25|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.nbcnewyork.com/news/local/MTA-Postpones-Plan-Modernize-Subway-Stations-Cuomo-De-Blasio-470926353.html|title=MTA Shelves Plan to Modernize Subway Stations Amid Criticism|last=Siff|first=Andrew|date=January 24, 2018|work=NBC New York|access-date=2018-01-25|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en}} The contract was put back for a vote in February, where it was ultimately approved.{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/new-york/mta-votes-cuomo-1b-plan-pretty-subway-stations-article-1.3836591|title=Foes Hit Gov's Station Fix Plan|date=2018-02-13|website=NY Daily News|access-date=2018-02-23}} {{-|left}} ==Station layout== {{NYCS Platform Layout Penn Station}} [[File:NYC subway Pennsylvania 36.JPG|thumb|left|175px|Trim line tablets]] [[File:NYC subway Pennsylvania 33.JPG|thumb|left|175px|Name on trim line]] Like [[34th Street–Penn Station (IND Eighth Avenue Line)|34th Street–Penn Station]] on the [[IND Eighth Avenue Line]] and [[Atlantic Avenue–Barclays Center (IRT Eastern Parkway Line)|Atlantic Avenue–Barclays Center]] on the [[IRT Eastern Parkway Line]], this station has two [[side platform]]s for local service and a center [[island platform]] for express service. This is due to the expected increase in ridership and to encourage riders to switch at the next stop northbound, [[Times Square–42nd Street (IRT Broadway–Seventh Avenue Line)|Times Square–42nd Street]], as it is set up in the usual island platform manner for [[cross-platform interchange]]s.{{cite web| url=http://nycsubway.org/perl/stations?6:3134| title=34th Street-Penn Station| website=NYCSubway.org| accessdate=August 27, 2008}} There is no free transfer between this station and the station of the same name on the IND Eighth Avenue Line, despite the fact that both connect to Penn Station. The nearest transfer location is at Times Square–42nd Street with a free transfer to [[42nd Street–Port Authority Bus Terminal (IND Eighth Avenue Line)|42nd Street–Port Authority Bus Terminal]]. {{-|left}} {{Midtown Manhattan subway cross section}} ===Exits=== [[File:34thAtPennIRT.jpg|thumb|right|250px|33rd Street Staircase]] 34th Street–Penn Station spans three streets (32nd, 33rd, and 34th Streets) with a set of entrances/exits at all of these streets. For the purposes of this article, entrance and exit are interchangeable.{{cite web|title=MTA Neighborhood Maps: Pennsylvania Station / Times Square|url=http://web.mta.info/maps/neighborhoods/mn/M08_PennStation_2015.pdf|website=[[Metropolitan Transportation Authority|mta.info]]|publisher=[[Metropolitan Transportation Authority]]|accessdate=December 11, 2015|date=2015}} * {{Access icon}} '''34th Street''': There are four entrances directly from the intersection of 34th Street and Seventh Avenue. On the local platforms the [[turnstile]]s for these exits are at platform level; passengers wishing to use the express platforms must use a passageway beneath the platforms and tracks. These entrances utilize the northern portions of the platforms. There is also a supplementary and handicapped-accessible entrance to the Penn Station complex in general from 34th Street. * '''33rd Street''': There are three direct entrances from the street at 33rd Street and Seventh Avenue. As a replacement for the southwestern corner's lack of an entrance, there is an underground entrance directly connecting the station with the Long Island Rail Road concourse in the Penn Station complex. The turnstiles for this entrance are located below the track level and utilize the central portions of the platforms. * '''32nd Street''': The main entrance to the Penn Station complex is located on the western end of 32nd Street. From there, passengers may go through the New Jersey Transit and Long Island Rail Road concourses and use the entrance to this station at the end of the latter's concourse. There is also a smaller exit from the station at the southern ends of the platforms that connects with the end of the New Jersey Transit concourse where it meets the Long Island Rail Road underneath the main corridor in the station that connects New Jersey Transit and Amtrak. There is also an entrance on the north side of 32nd Street between Seventh and Sixth Avenues. ==Ridership== 34th Street–Penn Station on the Broadway–Seventh Avenue Line is continually ranked as one of the busiest stations in the subway system. In 2016, it was the fifth-busiest subway station, with 27,741,367 riders as recorded by the [[Metropolitan Transportation Authority]]. By comparison, its sister station on the Eighth Avenue Line is ranked sixth-busiest, with 25,183,869 passengers. When the Broadway–Seventh Avenue Line station was a shuttle stop before the rest of the South Ferry extension opened, ridership was quite low; in its first year of operation, only 78,121 boardings were recorded.{{cite web|url=http://transit.frumin.net/subway/growth/nyc-station-ridership.xls.zip |title=1904-2006 ridership figures |publisher=Metropolitan Transportation Authority |accessdate=August 28, 2008 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110723132222/http://transit.frumin.net/subway/growth/nyc-station-ridership.xls.zip |archivedate=2011-07-23 |deadurl=yes |df= }} {{Infobox musical artist <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject Musicians --> | name = Adithya Srinivasan | image = Adithya_Srinivasan.jpg | image_size = | background = solo_singer | birth_name = | alias = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1992|6|19|df=y}} |birth_place = | death_date = | instrument = | genre = [[Ghazal]], [[Classical Music|Classical]], [[Pop music|Pop]], [[World music|World]] | occupation = | years_active = | label = Independent | associated_acts = [[Hariharan (singer)|Hariharan]], [[Ghulam Ali (singer)|Ghulam Ali]] | website = [http://adithyasrinivasan.com adithyasrinivasan.com] }} '''Adithya Srinivasan''' is an [[Indian people|Indian]] [[singer-songwriter]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://epaper.timesofindia.com/Default/Scripting/ArticleWin.asp?From=Archive&Source=Page&Skin=pastissues2&BaseHref=BGMIR/2012/06/13&PageLabel=21&EntityId=Ar02000&ViewMode=GIF |title=Bangalore Mirror / Music : Ghazal is the future |publisher=Bangalore Mirror |date=2012-06-13 |accessdate=2013-10-05}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://skore.in/post/66190554996/we-talked-to-the-rising-star-of-ghazal-aditya |title=The Score Magazine / Ek Garam Chai with |publisher=The Score Magazine |date=2013-11-01 |accessdate=2013-11-15 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203020411/http://skore.in/post/66190554996/we-talked-to-the-rising-star-of-ghazal-aditya |archivedate=2013-12-03 }}</ref> He is best known for his award winning [[ghazals]], and international singles in [[Classical Music|classical]], [[Pop music|pop]], and [[World music|world]] music genres.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/artist/adithya-srinivasan/id599803506 |title=iTunes USA Artist Page / Adithya Srinivasan| publisher=Apple Inc. |date=2013-01-11 |accessdate=2014-07-23}}</ref>{{Advert inline|date=November 2014}} His notable performances include sharing stage space with [[Hariharan (singer)|Hariharan]] and opening for [[Ghulam Ali (Ghazal singer)|Ghulam Ali]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://vimeo.com/76220059 |title=Adithya Srinivasan Opening Act Ghulam Ali - Live in Concert / Music : Adithya Srinivasan Opening Act Ghulam Ali - Live in Concert |publisher=Imagine Events|date=2012-04-08 |accessdate=2013-08-04}}</ref>
== Music career == Adithya's tribute to 6 ghazals originally rendered by [[Mehdi Hassan]], [[Jagjit Singh]], [[Hariharan (singer)|Hariharan]], [[Ghulam Ali (singer)|Ghulam Ali]] and [[Pankaj Udhas]] won him the Singer of the Year Silver Award from Swar Systems, [[Switzerland]].
Adithya's first international single Gham-e-Duniya written by the [[Mughal tribe|Mughal]] poet [[Mirza Ghalib]] and featuring a [[Miss Diva]] finalist, earned a 5 star rating on [[Apple Inc.|Apple]] [[iTunes]], and went viral on [[YouTube]].
In 2014, Adithya featured [[Grammy]] nominated pianist Jonathan Wesley and flautist Parth Chandiramani for Tu Hi Dilruba, landing a consideration in the 57th [[Grammy]] Awards ballot, and a Silver Award in the [[Southeast Asian]] VIMA Music Awards.
Adithya collaborated with [[Massachusetts]] based composer Sonaljit and [[Hollywood]] screen & stage actress Yanna Fabian for Devanke in 2015, landing a consideration in the 58th [[Grammy]] Awards ballot, a nomination in the 3rd Radio City Freedom Awards, and a Judge's Special Award in the [[Southeast Asian]] VIMA Music Awards.
In 2017, Adithya released Aarzu, an all acoustic ghazal written by [[Daagh Dehlvi]]. The single featured musicians from across [[India]], and was mastered by a [[Grammy]] winning engineer at the [[Abbey Road Studios]], [[United Kingdom]].
Adithya also featured on [[Grammy]] winning composer [[Laura Sullivan (composer)|Laura Sullivan]]'s 900 Voices.
== Corporate career ==
Adithya is a [[Singapore Management University]] graduate, and has worked in [[management consulting]] and [[investment banking]]. He is also a co-founder of MzQ! Entertainment, a [[digital commerce]] boutique.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/130721/entertainment-tvmusic/article/words-ghalib |title=Deccan Chronicle / Music : From the words of Ghalib ... |publisher=Deccan Chronicle |date=2013-06-21 |accessdate=2013-08-04 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203002513/http://www.deccanchronicle.com/130721/entertainment-tvmusic/article/words-ghalib |archivedate=2013-12-03 }}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://epaper.timesofindia.com/Default/Scripting/ArticleWin.asp?From=Archive&Source=Page&Skin=pastissues2&BaseHref=BGMIR/2013/04/02&PageLabel=2&EntityId=Pc00206&ViewMode=HTML |title=Bangalore Mirror / Music : Singers Bond |publisher=Bangalore Mirror |date=2013-04-02 |accessdate=2013-08-04}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://epaper.timesofindia.com/Default/Scripting/ArticleWin.asp?From=Archive&Source=Page&Skin=pastissues2&BaseHref=BGMIR/2013/07/09&PageLabel=2&EntityId=Ar00204&ViewMode=HTML |title=Bangalore Mirror / Music : Going Viral |publisher=Bangalore Mirror |date=2013-07-09 |accessdate=2013-08-04}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://epaper.timesofindia.com/Default/Scripting/ArticleWin.asp?From=Archive&Source=Page&Skin=MIRRORNEW&BaseHref=BGMIR%2F2014%2F04%2F14&PageLabel=20&EntityId=Ar02000&ViewMode=GIF |title=Bangalore Mirror / Music : Made Here, Mastered Elsewhere |publisher=Bangalore Mirror |date=2013-07-09 |accessdate=2013-08-04}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://epaper.newindianexpress.com/c/3004185 |title=Indian Express / Music : B'lore singer to send track for Grammys | publisher=Indian Express |date=2014-06-17 |accessdate=2014-06-20}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mzqentertainment.com/ |title=MzQ! Entertainment / Indian digital commerce boutique | publisher=GoDaddy/Weebly |date=2014-08-04 |accessdate=2014-08-04}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.donateasy.com/|title=Donateasy / philanthropic dot-com enterprise | publisher=GoDaddy/Weebly |date=2014-07-19 |accessdate=2014-10-21}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://epaper.deccanchronicle.com/articledetailpage.aspx?id=124716 |title=Donateasy / Goodwill Hunting |publisher=Deccan Chronicle |date=2014-10-27 |accessdate=2014-10-27 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangaloremirror.com/bangalore/others/Family-records-single-to-allay-sons-fears/articleshow/48240805.cms|title=Family records single to allay son’s fears | publisher=Times Bangalore Mirror |date=2015-07-28 |accessdate=2015-08-13}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thehindu.com/features/metroplus/society/adithya-srinivasan-journey-as-a-singer/article7173450.ece|title=The techie sings a new tune | publisher=The Hindu |date=2015-07-28 |accessdate=2015-05-05}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://globalvima.com/2016/05/02/vima-music-awards-final-nominees/ |title=VIMA MUSIC AWARDS Final Nominees |publisher=VIMA MUSIC AWARDS |date=2016-05-02 |accessdate=2016-05-02 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://sg.linkedin.com/in/adithyasrinivasan |title=Adithya Srinivasan LinkedIn |publisher=LinkedIn |date=2016-05-30 |accessdate=2016-05-30 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
== Discography ==
*2011: ''Ghazal Ka Mausam - A Tribute to the Legends'' *2012: ''Kaash Aisa Koi Manzur Hota'' *2013: ''Gham e Duniya'' *2014: ''Tu Hi Dilruba'' *2015: ''Devanke'' *2016: ''Signature'' *2017: ''Aarzu'' <!-- Do not add upcoming tracks without citing a reliable source. See also WP:NOTCRYSTAL -->
== Awards == {| class="wikitable" !Year !Work !Award !Result |- |2014 |Ghazal Ka Mausam - A Tribute to the Legends |Swar Systems Award for Singer of the Year |Silver Award |- |- |2014 |Tu Hi Dilruba |57th Grammy Award for Best Pop Solo Performance |First Round Ballot |- |- |2015 |Devanke |58th Grammy Award for Record of The Year |First Round Ballot |- |- |2016 |Devanke |3rd Radio City Freedom Award for Best Indie Collaboration of The Year |Nominated |- |- |2016 |Devanke |VIMA Music Award for Best Indian Song |Judge's Special Award |- |- |2016 |Tu Hi Dilruba |VIMA Music Award for Best Indian Song |Judge's Special Award |- |- |2016 |Tu Hi Dilruba |VIMA Music Award for Best Pop Song |Silver Award |- |}

{{EngvarB|date=October 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2014}} {{BLP sources|date=December 2015}} {{Chinese name|[[Lin (surname)|Ling (林)]]}} {{Infobox politician | honorific-prefix = [[Malay styles and titles|Yang Berhormat]] [[Dewan Negara|Senator]] [[Malay titles|Tuan]] | name=Alan Ling | native_name = {{nobold|林思健}} | native_name_lang = zh-my | honorific-suffix = | image = YB Alan Ling Sie Kiong.jpg | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1983|2|19|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Sibu]], [[Sarawak]], [[Malaysia]] | residence = [[Miri, Malaysia|Miri]], [[Sarawak]], [[Malaysia]] | death_date = | death_place = | term_start = 16 April 2011 | term_end = 7 May 2016 | predecessor = [[George Chan Hong Nam]] | successor = Sebastian Ting Chiew Yew | majority = 1,590 (2011), 2,112 (2016) | assembly = Sarawak State Legislative | constituency_AM = [[Piasau]] | citizenship = [[Malaysian people|Malaysian]] | party = [[Democratic Action Party]] | occupation = [[Lawyer]], [[Businessman]] | alma_mater = [[University of Sheffield]] }}
'''Alan Ling Sie Kiong''' ({{zh|s=林思健|hp=Lín Sījiàn}}; born 19 February 1983) is a Malaysian lawyer and politician. He is currently holding office of DAP Sarawak Secretary and Pakatan Harapan Sarawak Secretary.
Ling was appointed and sworn in as Senator in the Upper House [[Dewan Negara]] of [[Parliament of Malaysia]] on 27 August 2018.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2018/08/28/12-pakatan-and-warisan-members-made-senators/|title=12 Pakatan and Warisan members made senators |date=28 August 2018 |work=|publisher=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|language=|accessdate=3 September 2018}}</ref>
He spent his childhood in Nanga Medamit, Limbang, Sarawak where his parents started their first business venture by operating a small grocery shops next to a river in the rural area.{{citation needed|reason=this is very personal information and needs a reliable source|date=December 2015}}
Ling received his primary education in SRB Chung Hua Limbang, North School Miri and secondary school in SMK St. Joseph Miri. He is a Christian.
Ling graduated from the [[University of Sheffield]] with a [[Bachelor of Laws]] honours degree. He is an Advocate & Solicitor of the [[High Court in Malaya]] and [[High Court in Sabah and Sarawak]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Rolls (no. 1132)|url=http://sarawak-advocates.org.my/index.php/rolls-a-directories/rolls |publisher=Advocates' Association of Sarawak |accessdate=}}</ref>
Ling became the managing partner of an established law firm Suhaili & Ling Advocates in [[Miri, Malaysia|Miri]] at the age of 27.<ref>{{cite web |title=Suhaili & Ling Advocates. (Miri) He has particular interest in criminal law and was a pupil to the late YB Karpal Singh.
|url=http://sarawak-advocates.org.my/index.php/rolls-a-directories/legal-firms/423-suhaili-a-bong-advocates-miri |publisher=Advocates' Association of Sarawak |accessdate=6 May 2011}}</ref>
He is also the partner of Tee, Liew & Co which is situated in Petaling Jaya and Johor Bahru in West Malaysia.
Besides legal qualification, he is a licensed auctioneer, company secretary and also actively involved in the business field since his university time.
During his stay in United Kingdom, he was the President of [[Malaysian Law Students Union in the United Kingdom and Eire]] (KPUM) for the term 2004/2005.<ref>http://www.kpum.org/ourteam/past-committees/</ref>
He also held the post of President for MCA Club United Kingdom for the term 2005/2006.
At the age of 25 in 2008, he successfully obtained license from [[Bank Negara Malaysia]] to operate remittance business in partnership with [[Western Union]], it is one of the pioneers non-bank remittance operators in Malaysia. In 2015, he sold the company operation to another remittance operator.
Ling joined DAP in 2011 and had been elected Honourable Member of the [[Sarawak State Legislative Assembly]] for [[Piasau]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Y.B. Encik Alan Ling Sie Kiong |url=http://www.dun.sarawak.gov.my/modules/web/pages.php?mod=webpage&sub=page&id=102}}</ref> He won the seat at the age of 28 by upsetting the then Sarawak Deputy Chief Minister cum Sarawak United People's Party President Tan Sri Dr [[George Chan Hong Nam]] in the [[Sarawak state election, 2011|2011 state election]]. He defeated Chan by a 1,590-vote majority.<ref>{{cite web|title=N.63 Piasau |url=http://semak.spr.gov.my/dunsarawak/module/5_KeputusanDUNAWAMVIEW.php?kod=21963 |publisher=[[Election Commission of Malaysia]] |accessdate=6 May 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110722025017/http://semak.spr.gov.my/dunsarawak/module/5_KeputusanDUNAWAMVIEW.php?kod=21963 |archivedate=22 July 2011 |df=dmy }}</ref>
Ling is a charismatic young politician and has been widely known for his excellent oratory skill, down to earth approach and dedication towards his constituents. He has a community centre within his constituency.
He has been appointed honourable/legal advisors to several associations in Miri and is a well-known lawyer in Miri.
He seek for re-election in 2016 Sarawak State Election but lost to BN SUPP candidate. His focus is now on his legal practice, business interest and party works.
==References== {{reflist}}

revision.comment: [[MOS:APOSTROPHE]], citation improvement, we don't need "author=" if it just duplicates the "publisher=" information, and we don't need to duplicate the newspaper name is the "title="
revision.text:
{{Primary sources|date=July 2014}} '''As You Sow''' is a non-profit foundation chartered to promote [[corporate social responsibility]] (for example on [[human rights]]) through shareholder advocacy, coalition building, and legal strategies.<ref name=AboutUs/><ref>[http://www.guidestar.org/FinDocuments/2013/943/169/2013-943169008-0ac1472a-9.pdf IRS Form 990]</ref>
==History== As You Sow was founded in 1992<ref name=AboutUs>{{cite web|url=http://www.asyousow.org/about-us/ |title=About Us |publisher=As You Sow |date= |accessdate=2017-03-22}}</ref> and has five program areas for addressing its environmental and social concerns: Energy, Environmental Health, Waste, Power of the Proxy, and Human Rights.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.asyousow.org/our-work/ |title=Our Work |publisher=As You Sow |accessdate=2015-08-16}}</ref> Most of As You Sow's Programs include shareholder advocacy to pressure companies to adopt responsible policies. According to As You Sow, "Shareholder advocacy leverages the power of stock ownership in publicly traded companies to promote environmental, social, and governance change from within."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.asyousow.org/about-us/theory-of-change/shareholder-advocacy/|title=Shareholder Advocacy|publisher=As You Sow |accessdate=2015-06-19}}</ref>
Under the Environmental Health Program, As You Sow's Toxic Enforcement Initiative seeks to reduce and remove carcinogenic exposures by pursuing compliance with California's [[California Proposition 65 (1986)|Safe Drinking Water and Toxic Enforcement Act]]. As You Sow says that its Environmental Enforcement Program<ref name="asyousow1">{{cite web |url=http://www.asyousow.org/our-work/environmental-health/toxic-enforcement// |title=Toxic Enforcement |publisher=As You Sow |date= |accessdate=2014-01-06}}</ref> has reached settlements with hundreds of companies resulting in products being relabeled or reformulated to remove [[Dangerous goods|hazardous]] ingredients. Funds secured through these settlements are disbursed through grants to support other organizations throughout the state.{{cn|date=August 2015}}
==Engagements with Corporations== [[Dunkin Donuts]] announced they would remove [[titanium dioxide]] from their powdered donuts after being pressured by As You Sow.<ref name=CNNDunkin>{{cite web|author=Amy Westervelt |url=https://www.theguardian.com/sustainable-business/2015/mar/11/dunkin-donuts-to-remove-whitening-agent-from-donuts |title=Dunkin' Donuts to remove titanium dioxide from donuts | Guardian Sustainable Business |publisher=The Guardian |date= |accessdate=2015-08-16}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Isidore |first=Chris |url=http://money.cnn.com/2015/03/10/news/companies/dunkin-donuts-titanium-dioxide/index.html |title=Dunkin' Donuts to remove titanium dioxide from donuts - Mar. 10, 2015 |publisher=Money.cnn.com |date=2015-03-10 |accessdate=2015-08-16}}</ref> The company had been adding the ingredient to make the donuts appear more brightly white, while As You Sow had alleged that the additive was a [[nanomaterial]] with unknown health effects that could cause damage to [[DNA]] when consumed.<ref name=CNNDunkin/> The company said they disagreed with the allegations, but would nevertheless remove the ingredient from their recipe.
With a coalition of other investment organizations, As You Sow has pressed oil and gas companies to disclose and address the risks of [[hydraulic fracturing]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Casey |first=Tina |url=http://www.triplepundit.com/2013/05/shareholders-press-companies-to-disclose-fracking-risk/ |title=Shareholders press oil and gas companies to disclose fracking risks |publisher=Triplepundit.com |date=2013-05-23 |accessdate=2015-08-16}}</ref>
Through its Energy Program, As You Sow has engaged [[Big Oil|Supermajor]] oil companies, including [[ExxonMobil]], which for the first time issue a report about corporate assets that could be at risk from [[Climate change]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nationaljournal.com/energy/wall-street-your-climate-war-has-arrived-20140626 |title=Wall Street: Your Climate War Has Arrived |publisher=NationalJournal.com |date= |accessdate=2015-08-16}}</ref>
As You Sow regularly publishes reports on issues relating to corporate social responsibility, including [[executive compensation]]<ref>{{cite web|last=Francis |first=Theo |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/study-finds-trends-in-votes-about-say-on-pay-1423717262 |title=Study Finds Trends in Votes About 'Say on Pay' |publisher=WSJ |date=2015-02-12 |accessdate=2015-08-16}}</ref> and recyclable packaging in the food and beverage industries.<ref>{{cite web|author=Marc Gunther |url=https://www.theguardian.com/sustainable-business/2015/jan/29/what-a-waste-study-finds-big-us-brands-stuck-on-disposable-packaging |title=What a waste: study finds big US brands stuck on disposable packaging |publisher=The Guardian |date=2015-01-29 |accessdate=2015-08-16}}</ref>
==Awards== In 2010, As You Sow received the California Stewardship Bow and Arrow Award for Coalition Building, sponsored by the California Department of Resources Recycling and Recovery (CalRecycle), which recognized As You Sow's engagement of the three largest U.S. beverage companies, leading each to commit to recycling a majority of their post-consumer containers over the next six years.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.greenbiz.com/news/2010/08/20/netapp-as-you-sow-more-lauded-product-stewardship |title=NetApp, As You Sow and More Lauded for Product Stewardship |publisher=GreenBiz |date=2010-08-20 |accessdate=2015-08-16}}</ref>
==See also== *[[Socially responsible investing]] *[[Corporate social responsibility]]
==References== <references/>
==External links== *{{Official website|http://www.asyousow.org/ }}

page.title: Association of German Chambers of Industry and Commerce

revision.comment: Robot - Speedily moving category Labour relations to [[:Category:Labor relations]] per [[WP:CFDS|CFDS]].
revision.text:
{{Infobox organization | name = Association of German Chambers of Industry and Commerce | logo = | type = [[Advocacy group]] | founded_date = about 1872 | founder = | location = [[Berlin]], [[Germany]] | origins = | key_people = Hans Heinrich Driftmann, President of DIHK
Martin Wansleben, Chief Executive of the DIHK | area_served = [[Germany]]
[[European Union]]
[[United States]] | focus = Business advocacy | method = trade promotion
Political lobbying | revenue = | endowment = | num_volunteers = | owner = | Non-profit_slogan = | homepage = [http://www.dihk.de/en DIHK]
[http://www.ahk-usa.com AHK USA] | tax_exempt = yes | dissolved = | footnotes = }} '''Association of German Chambers of Industry and Commerce''' ({{lang-de|Deutscher Industrie- und Handelskammertag}}, '''DIHK''') is a [[Germany|German]] 'chamber,' similar to an [[England|English]] [[guild]] but is required under German law and provides [[Politics|political]] influence of a [[trade union]]. This organization was formerly known as the ''Deutscher Industrie- und Handelstag'' or ''DIHT''. ==DIHK== In Germany, '[[Chambers of Commerce]] and Industry' is an organization for 79 'chambers' who represents companies within the German state. The DIHK provides over 'three million entrepreneurs' or association members, representing small kiosks and shops to larger commercial companies, with political influence. DIHK has its headquarters in [[Berlin]], a major office in [[Brussels]] and representative offices throughout [[Europe]].{{Cite web |accessdate=September 24, 2012 |url=http://www.dihk.de/en |title='Chambers of Commerce and Industry' |author=Deutscher Industrie und Handelskammertag |work=DIHK |publisher=Deutscher Industrie und Handelskammertag |year=2012}} See also:[http://www.dihk.de/en/about/who-we-are Who we are] Association members are under [[Chamber of Commerce#Compulsory/public law chambers|German Chamber of Commerce]] compulsory or public law model, [[Business|enterprises]] of certain sizes, types, or sectors are obliged to become members of the chamber. This model is common in [[European Union]] countries ([[France]],[[André-Pierre Nouvion]], ''Chambres de commerce et d'industrie'' - Encyclopédie juridique [[Dalloz]] - Répertoire de droit commercial, 2005 [[Germany]], [[Italy]], [[Spain]]), but also in [[Japan]]. Main tasks of the chambers are foreign trade promotion, vocational training, regional economic development, and general services to their members. The chambers were given responsibilities of public administration in various fields by the state which they exercise in order management. The chambers also have a consultative function; this means the chambers must be consulted whenever a new law related to industry or commerce is proposed.{{cite web|url=http://www.cipe.org/programs/training/pdf/Chamber_Primer.pdf |title=Markus Pilgrim and Ralf Meier, Chamber Primer |format=PDF |date= |accessdate=2011-12-21 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110107031727/http://www.cipe.org/programs/training/pdf/Chamber_Primer.pdf |archivedate=2011-01-07 |df= }} In Germany, for over 150 years, the chambers of commerce and industry (''IHK - Industrie- und Handelskammer'') and the chambers of skilled crafts (''HwK - Handwerkskammer'') are public statutory bodies with self-administration under the inspectorate of the state ministry of economy. Enterprises are members by law according to the chamber act (''IHK-Gesetz'') of 1956. Because of this, such chambers are much bigger than chambers under private law. IHK Munich, the biggest German chamber of commerce, has 350,000 member companies.{{cite web|title=IHK München|url=http://www.muenchen.ihk.de|accessdate=31 August 2010}} Germany also has compulsory chambers for "free occupations" such as architects, dentists, engineers, lawyers, notaries, physicians and pharmacists. Exceptions are skilled craftsmen, [[freelancer]]s and agricultural businesses.[http://www.dihk.de/english/aboutus/overview.pdf Overview of DIHK]{{dead link|date=October 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} ==AHK USA== [[File:AHK USA-logo.svg|thumb|300px|Logo of AHK USA]] German American Chambers of Commerce is a bilateral trade organization promoting German and German-American businesses within the United States and worldwide in 90 countries and 130 locations. The AHKs throughout the world are under the '[http://www.deinternational.de/ DEinternational]' brand name.{{Cite web |accessdate=September 24, 2012 |url=http://www.ahk-usa.com/ |title=German American Chambers of Commerce |author= Deutsch-Amerikanische Handelskammer |work=AHK USA |publisher=Deutscher Industrie und Handelskammertag |year=2012}} The GACCs represent about 2,500 members in the United States under the abrieviation AHK USA. In German this is; Deutsch-Amerikanische Handelskammer or AHK. It has offices in [[Atlanta]], [[Chicago]], [[New York City|New York]], [[Philadelphia]] and [[San Francisco]] with a liaison office to the [[Representative of German Industry and Trade]] in Washington D.C. The GACC Consulting Services Department's goal is to assist and support German companies with USA market entry and expansion. They do this by providing "events, such as networking receptions, economic forums, members only events, Industry specific conferences, business luncheons, seminars" including lobbying the American government agencies. They also provide companies with [[market analysis]], marketing concepts, legal and tax assistance, business representation, and [[Trade show]] support.{{Cite web |accessdate=September 24, 2012 |url=http://www.ahk-usa.com/en/market-entry-usa/market-entry-usa/ |title=German American Chambers of Commerce - Market entry USA |author= Deutsch-Amerikanische Handelskammer |work=AHK USA |publisher=Deutscher Industrie und Handelskammertag |year=2012}} The GACC publishes various articles, journals and reports. These include, but are not limited to:{{Cite web |accessdate=September 24, 2012 |url=http://www.ahk-usa.com/en/publications/publications/ |title=German American Chambers of Commerce - Publications |author=Deutsch-Amerikanische Handelskammer |work=AHK USA |publisher=Deutscher Industrie und Handelskammertag |year=2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120720004508/http://www.ahk-usa.com/en/publications/publications/ |archivedate=July 20, 2012 |df= }} * Subsidiaries of German Firms in the U.S - Over 3,500 firms in the U.S., which are owned 50% or more by a German firm. * National GACC Membership Directory - About 2,500 companies in the US. It also contains contact information for the parent German organization. * U.S.-German Economic Yearbook - An annual report which provides an "in-depth view of US-German politics, economics and finance." * German American Trade Quarterly - This quarterly magazine provides an inlook into "German-American economic, corporate, political, and trade fair news ..." * Visa and Work Permits for the USA - Regarding US laws for German workers. * Understanding German and American Business Cultures - A managerial guide to US and German business practices and differences. ==See also== {{Commons|Trade unions}} *[[Trade association|Business association]] *[[Lobbying]] *[[Non-governmental organization]] *[[Trade group]] *[[Trade union]] *[[United States Chamber of Commerce]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20070529024244/http://www.dihk.de/english/ Website of DIHK] {{en icon}} * [http://www.ahk-usa.com Official website of German American Chambers of Commerce] * [http://www.deinternational.de DEinternational, the brand name of the AHKs] * [http://ahk.de Official website of Chambers of Commerce] * [http://www.gtai.de Germany Trade and Invest] * [http://www.rgit-usa.com Representative of German Industry and Trade] * [http://www.germancompanies.us Online Directory of German Subsidiaries in the US] * [http://www.transatlantic-news.com The News Portal of the GACCs and GTAI] * {{PM20|FID=co/045919|TEXT=Documents and clippings about|NAME=}} {{EUROCHAMBRES}} [[Category:Trade unions in Germany]] [[Category:Labor relations|German Chambers of Industry and Commerce]] [[Category:Chambers of commerce in Germany|German Chambers of Industry and Commerce]] [[Category:Chambers of commerce in the United States|German Chambers of Industry and Commerce]] [[Category:Non-profit organisations based in Berlin]] [[Category:Business organisations based in Germany]] [[Category:Lobbying in Germany]]

revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=March 2016}} {{Infobox criminal | name = Babak Zanjani | image = 5th session of Babak Zanjani's court-10.jpg | image_size = 250px | caption = Zanjani in the [[Islamic Revolutionary Court]], November 2015 | birth_name = Babak Morteza Zanjani | birth_date = {{bda|1974|03|12|df=yes}}<ref>https://www.treasury.gov/press-center/press-releases/Pages/jl1893.aspx</ref> | birth_place = [[Tehran]], Iran | nationality = Iranian | ethnicity = | residence = | occupation = Businessman | alma_mater = | networth = | website = | footnotes = | signature = | criminal_charge = [[Mofsed-e-filarz|Spreading corruption on earth]] | penalty = [[Death penalty]] | conviction_status = Awaiting execution | conviction = | capture_status = Arrested | apprehended = 2013 | imprisoned = [[Evin Prison]] }} '''Babak Morteza Zanjani''' ({{lang-fa|بابک مرتضی زنجانی}}, born 21 March 1974)<ref>https://www.treasury.gov/press-center/press-releases/Pages/jl1893.aspx</ref> is an Iranian billionaire and [[business magnate]]. He was the managing director of the [[UAE]]-based Sorinet Group, one of Iran's largest business conglomerates.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://sorinetgroup.com|title=Sorinet Group}}</ref> In late 2013, he was arrested and accused of withholding $2.7 billion of government money owned by the [[Ministry of Petroleum (Iran)|Ministry of Petroleum]], in his attempts to facilitate Iran's oil revenue hindered by the [[sanctions against Iran]]. He was convicted of corruption, sentenced to death and is currently awaiting execution.
Several commentators have stated that Zanjani is perhaps a “[[fall guy]]” for corruption scandals in Iran.<ref> *{{cite web|title=How Babak Zanjani Went From Iran's Top Sanctions Buster to Dead Billionaire Walking|url=http://www.newsweek.com/2016/03/25/babak-zanjani-iran-sanctions-corruption-execution-436360.html|author=Sune Engel Rasmussen|date=14 March 2016|access-date=1 January 2017|quote=Zanjani serves as a fall guy for the current government’s attempt, at least in public, to break with the cronyism of the Ahmadinejad era.|work=Newsweek}} *{{cite web|title=Babak Zanjani and the complicity of Iran|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/indepth/opinion/2016/03/babak-zanjani-complicity-iran-160310131026736.html|author=Hamid Dabashi|date=10 March 2016|access-date=1 January 2017|quote=The full exposure of such corruptions scandalises not only the crook who engaged in such financial atrocities, but those who enabled him and are now using him as "the fall guy".|work=Al Jazeera}} *{{cite web|title=Downfall of Iran’s billionaire sanctions-buster|url=http://www.thenational.ae/world/middle-east/downfall-of-irans-billionaire-sanctions-buster|author= Michael Theodoulou|date=11 January 2014|access-date=1 January 2017|quote=Scott Lucas, an Iran specialist at Birmingham University in England, suspects that Mr Zanjani will become the “fall guy” for corruption scandals involving powerful figures and institutions during the Ahmadinejad era. “More senior figures are likely to escape unscathed, provided Mr Zanjani pays the price,” Mr Lucas said.|work=The National}}</ref>
==Sorinet Group==
Sorinet Group ({{lang-fa|گروه شرکت‌های سورینت}}) is an Iranian business [[Conglomerate (company)|conglomerate]]. The company is one of Iran's largest business conglomerates. Sorinet businesses include cosmetics, finance and banking, hospitality, commercial aviation, infrastructure, building material, information technology and international real estate development. It operates in countries including Iran, United Arab Emirates, Turkey, [[Tajikistan]], Malaysia, China. He also owned [[Qeshm Airlines]] and [[Rah Ahan Sorinet F.C.]] in Iran.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://rahahansport.ir/inside.aspx?cat=news&g=1006 |title=Zanjani to Rahahan footballers: Raise your self-confidence |work=Rah Ahan Sorinet F.C |date=18 January 2013 |accessdate=19 February 2013 }}{{dead link|date=October 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
In 2013, Zanjani stated that his net worth was $13.5 billion.<ref>{{cite news |url =https://www.nytimes.com/2013/10/05/world/middleeast/to-this-tycoon-iran-sanctions-are-like-gold.html?_r=0|title = To This Tycoon, Iran Sanctions Were Like Gold|publisher = NY Times |date = 5 October 2013 |work = News (in English)|accessdate= 21 October 2016|first=Thomas |last=Erdbrink}}</ref>
==EU sanctions against Iran== Zanjani was named in the [[European Union sanctions against Iran#Sanctions|restrictive measures against Iran]] in December 2012 by the [[EU council]] on the grounds of "assisting designated entities to violate the provisions of the EU regulation on Iran and is providing financial support to the government of Iran".<ref name=eurt>{{cite web |url = http://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/LexUriServ.do?uri=OJ:L:2012:356:0055:0060:EN:PDF|title= Council Implementing Regulation (EU) No 1264/2012 of 21 December 2012|work=Official Journal of the European Union|date=23 December 2012|accessdate=20 February 2013}}</ref> Zanjani was claimed to be "a key facilitator for Iranian oil deals and transferring oil-related money".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/12/22/us-eu-iran-sanctions-idUSBRE8BL04L20121222|title=Tougher EU sanctions against Iran come into force|author=Barbara Lewis|work=Reuters |date=23 December 2012|accessdate=19 February 2013}}</ref> He denied the accusation, declining any ties with the Iranian government and calling the Europeans' decision "a mistake".<ref>{{cite web|url= https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/12/23/us-iran-sanctions-zanjani-idUSBRE8BM06920121223 |title = Iranian businessman denies EU sanctions-busting accusation|author= Humeyra Pamuk|work = Reuters|date=23 December 2012|accessdate=19 February 2013 }}</ref>
The [[European Union|EU]] [[sanctions against Iran]] describe Zanjani as "a key facilitator for Iranian oil deals and transferring oil related money" and accuses First Islamic Bank of being used to channel Iranian oil-related payments.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://archive.radiozamaneh.com/english/content/businessman-sees-upside-sanctions|title= Businessman sees upside of sanctions|work=Radio Zamaneh|date=13 April 2013|accessdate= 13 April 2013}}</ref> Zanjani said the complex nature of his companies' transactions, involving large sums, might have misled EU authorities. Zanjani's companies are or may be involved in the Labuan Iran oil smuggling on the eastern coast of [[Malaysia]]. Labuan has been serving as a drop-off spot for Iranian crude.
==Alleged dual nationality== In January 2013, an Iranian news website, [[Baztab]], reported that Zanjani holds a [[Danish passport]] in addition to his Iranian one, a claim which was later denied by Zanjani. He called the passport's copy "fake", saying in an interview with the news website of [[Rah Ahan Yazdan F.C.|Rahahan F.C.]], his football team: "This story [the copy of my passport] is too badly fabricated that they even put my picture on the passport without a tie. However, it is obligatory to tie a necktie to take pictures for European passports," which is not true.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://rahahansport.ir/inside.aspx?cat=news&g=1062 |title=Zanjani's comments on the recent allegations and accusations |work=Rahahan F.C. |date=6 February 2013 |accessdate=21 February 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130216034922/http://rahahansport.ir/inside.aspx?cat=news&g=1062 |archivedate=16 February 2013 |df=dmy }}</ref>
==Arrest and conviction== On 30 December 2013, Zanjani was arrested by Iranian police for his alleged role in the [[2013 corruption scandal in Turkey|corruption scandal in Turkey]], in which he was accused of embezzling more than €2.7 billion.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.radiofarda.com/content/f12_babak_zanjani_not_paying_irans_oil_money/25216202.html/%D8%A7%D8%AA%D9%87%D8%A7%D9%85 |title=Zanjani arrested |work=Radio Farda |date=30 December 2013 |accessdate=23 March 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140317001050/http://www.radiofarda.com/content/f12_babak_zanjani_not_paying_irans_oil_money/25216202.html/%D8%A7%D8%AA%D9%87%D8%A7%D9%85 |archivedate=17 March 2014 |df=dmy }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.khabaronline.ir/detail/330120/society/judiciary |title=Babak Zanjani was arrested|work=Khabar Online|accessdate=23 March 2014}}</ref> Some days later, a spokesman from the [[National Bank of Tajikistan]] denied any cooperation between Zanjani and the bank and claimed all documents presented by Zanjani about their two-way communications were fake.<ref>[http://www.rferl.org/content/tajikistan-central-bank-iran-ties/25216499.html Tajik National Bank Denies Link With Iranian Businessman] ''Radio Free Europe''</ref> He was tried in an [[Islamic Revolutionary Court]]. On 6 March 2016, he was convicted and sentenced to death for embezzlement and "[[Mofsed-e-filarz|spreading corruption on earth]]".<ref name="death">{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/mar/06/iranian-billionaire-babak-zanjanis-entenced-to-death-embezzlement?CMP=twt_gu|title=Iranian billionaire Babak Zanjani sentenced to death for embezzlement|date=6 March 2016|work=Reuters|publisher=The Guardian|accessdate=6 March 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-35739377|title=Iran billionaire sentenced to death|work=BBC|date=6 March 2016|accessdate=6 March 2016}}</ref> In December 2016, the [[Supreme Court of Iran]] confirmed the sentence.<ref>https://www.reuters.com/article/us-iran-billionaire-sentence/irans-supreme-court-upholds-tycoons-death-sentence-for-graft-idUSKBN13S09P</ref>
==See also== * [[Reza Zarrab]]
==References== {{Reflist|2}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Zanjani, Babak}}
==External links== {{commons cat|Babak Zanjani}}

revision.text:
A '''Bachelor of Commerce''' (''baccalaureates commercii'', abbreviated '''B.Com.''' or '''B.Comm.''') is an [[undergraduate degree]] in [[commerce]] (or [[business]]) and related subjects, usually awarded in [[Canada]], [[Australia]], [[India]], [[Ireland]], [[New Zealand]], [[Pakistan]], [[South Africa]] and other [[Commonwealth of Nations|Commonwealth]] countries; however, the degree is no longer offered in the United Kingdom.
==Structure==
{| class="wikitable floatright" | width="250" |- style="text-align:center;" | Common areas of study |- | * [[Accounting]] * [[Actuarial science]] * [[Advertising]] * [[internal auditing|Assurance]] * Business System Analysis * [[Banking]] * [[Business economics]] * [[Computers]] and [[Management Information Systems|Management Information]] Systems * [[Decision analysis|Decision Analysis]] * [[Economics]] and [[Econometrics]] * [[Electronic commerce]] * [[Entrepreneurship]] * [[Finance]] and [[financial market|Financial Market]]s * [[Government]] * [[Human resources|Human Resources]] * [[Industrial psychology|Industrial Psychology]] * [[Information Management]] * [[Insurance]] * [[Labor relations|Labor Relations]] * [[Law]] * [[Logistics Management]] * [[Management]] * [[Management science]] * [[Marketing]] and [[Communication]]s * [[Mathematics]] * [[Operations Management]] * [[Organizational studies]] * [[Politics]] and [[Public Policy]] * [[Supply chain management]] * [[Risk management|Risk Management]] / [[Financial risk management|Financial Risk Management]] * [[Strategic management|Strategic Management]] * [[Statistics]] * [[Taxation]] * [[Transport Economics]] |}
===Bachelor of Commerce=== The [[Bachelor's degree|Bachelor]] of Commerce degree<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.varsitycollege.co.za/programmes/full-time/bachelor-of-commerce-bcom|title=Bachelor Of Commerce (Bcom) - Varsity College|website=www.varsitycollege.co.za|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170831131853/https://www.varsitycollege.co.za/programmes/full-time/bachelor-of-commerce-bcom|archivedate=2017-08-31|df=}}</ref> is designed to provide students with a wide range of managerial skills, while building competence in a particular area of business (see aside). Most universities, therefore, plan the degree such that in addition to their [[academic major|major]], students are exposed to general business principles, taking courses in accounting, finance, business management, human resources, marketing, and economics; some programs also require [[Business statistics|(business) statistics]], [[Business mathematics#University level|(introductory) calculus]] and information systems. Depending on the institution, a formal [[academic major]] may or may not be established. Regardless, a Bachelor of Commerce degree requires students to take the majority of their courses in business-related subjects, including the aside, among others.
For a comparison with other business degrees, see [[Business education#Undergraduate education]].
===Honours Bachelor of Commerce=== The [[Honours degree|Honours]] Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com. (Hons) or B.Comm. (Hons) or H.B.Com. or H.B.Comm.) is further advanced. It may consist of a four-year program<ref>{{cite web|url=https://ucanwest.ca/undergraduate-programs/bachelor-of-commerce|title=Bachelor of Commerce Degree (Bcom)- University Canada West|website=ucanwest.ca|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160807044341/https://ucanwest.ca/undergraduate-programs/bachelor-of-commerce|archivedate=2016-08-07|df=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uoit.ca/ac-calendar/0506/EN/main/programs/103887/bcom_hons_92.html|title=Commerce - Bachelor of Commerce (Honours)|first=The University of Ontario Institute of|last=Technology|website=www.uoit.ca}}</ref> or of a one-year program taken subsequent to a three-year [[Bachelor's degree]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://sydney.edu.au/courses/Bachelor-of-Commerce-Honours |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-02-21 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140226105318/http://sydney.edu.au/courses/Bachelor-of-Commerce-Honours |archivedate=2014-02-26 |df= }}</ref> The degree requires additional academic courses to be completed with higher academic performance standards and may also require a researched [[thesis]] component; the one-year program is often focused exclusively on a single subject-area.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.unisa.ac.za/qualifications/|title=Qualifications|website=www.unisa.ac.za|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140216065503/http://www.unisa.ac.za/qualifications/|archivedate=2014-02-16|df=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.wits.ac.za/academic/clm/sebs/newsebswebsite/postgraduateprogrammes/14711/honours_degree.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2015-11-26 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151126230943/http://www.wits.ac.za/academic/clm/sebs/newsebswebsite/postgraduateprogrammes/14711/honours_degree.html |archivedate=2015-11-26 |df= }}</ref>
The Honours Bachelor of Commerce degree often serves as an abridgement (or entry requirement) between the undergraduate program and postgraduate programs,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://bcom.unimelb.edu.au/about/honours|title=BCom Students - Faculty of Business and Economics|website=bcom.unimelb.edu.au|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120316005629/http://www.bcom.unimelb.edu.au/about/honours/|archivedate=2012-03-16|df=}}</ref> including the [[Master of Commerce]] (M.Com. or M.Comm.) and the [[Master of Business Administration]] (MBA) degrees.
===Duration=== The [[curriculum]] generally lasts three years in [[Australia]], [[New Zealand]], [[India]], [[Malta]], [[South Africa]], some parts of [[Canada]] and [[Hong Kong]]. The curriculum requires four years of study in the [[Republic of Ireland]], the majority of [[Canada]], [[Ghana]], the [[Philippines]] and the [[Netherlands]]. In [[Nepal]], the duration of the program can be three years.
In [[South Africa]], [[New Zealand]], [[Australia]] and some universities in [[India]], the B.Com. (Hons) degree is considered an additional [[postgraduate]] qualification, whereas in [[Malta]], an additional year of study is not considered a postgraduate qualification. In [[Pakistan]], [http://pu.edu.pk/home/department/22/Hailey-College-of-Commerce] the B.Com. degree lasts two years, the B.Com. (Hons) degree lasts three years, and a four-year program leads to the BS (Hons) Commerce degree.
==History== :''See: [[Birmingham Business School (University of Birmingham)|Birmingham Business School#History and background]].''<!--{{Unreferenced section|date=April 2010}} --> The Bachelor of Commerce degree was first offered at the [[University of Birmingham]]. The [[Birmingham Business School (University of Birmingham)|University's School of Commerce]] was founded by [[William Ashley (economic historian)|William Ashley]], an Englishman from [[Oxford University]], who was the first professor of Political Economy and Constitutional History in the Faculty of Arts at the [[University of Toronto]]. Ashley left Toronto in 1892, spent a few years at [[Harvard University]], and then went back to England to the new University of Birmingham where he founded the School of Commerce. Ashley began the program which was the forerunner of many other B.Com. degree programs throughout the [[British Empire]].
Eighteenth-century economists had divided the English economy into three sectors: agriculture, manufacturing, and commerce. Commerce included the transportation, marketing and financing of goods. The Birmingham program in Commerce included economic geography, economic history, general economics, modern languages, and accountancy. <!-- Original text: William Ashley, an Englishman from [[Oxford University]], as the first Professor of Political Economy and Constitutional History in the Faculty of Arts of the University of Toronto. Ashley left Toronto in 1892, spent a few years at Harvard University, and then went back to England to the new University of Birmingham where he founded the School of Commerce and began the program leading to the first Bachelor of Commerce degree - the forerunner of many BCom degree programs throughout the British Empire. Eighteenth-century economists had divided the English economy into three sectors: agriculture, manufacturing, and commerce. Commerce included the transportation, marketing, and financing of goods. The Birmingham program included economic geography, economic history, general economics, modem languages, and accountancy.-->
==See also== *[[Bachelor of Accountancy]] (B.Acc.), a specialized degree in accountancy *[[Bachelor of Business]] (BBus) *[[Bachelor of Business & Information Technology]] (BBIT) *[[Bachelor of Business Administration]] (BBA) *[[Bachelor of Business Science]] *[[Bachelor of Economics]] *[[Bachelor of Public Administration]] (BPA) *[[Business school|Business School]] *[[:Category:Business schools|Business schools listed by country]] *[[Master of Commerce]]
==References== {{Reflist}} Bachelor of Business & Information Technology (BBIT) http://www.ibitpu.edu.pk/
[[Category:Bachelor's degrees|Commerce, Bachelor of]] [[Category:Business qualifications]]

revision.text:
{{Banking |image=London.bankofengland.arp.jpg |caption=The [[Bank of England]], established in 1694.}} Under [[English law]], a '''bank has a general right to combine accounts''' where a customer has multiple accounts with the same bank.<ref name=Ellinger>{{cite book |author1=E.P. Ellinger |author2=E. Lomnicka |author3=C. Hare |year=2011|title=Ellinger's Modern Banking Law |edition=5th|publisher=[[Oxford University Press]]|isbn=978-019-923209-3|page=248}}</ref> The right has been recognised since at least 1860<ref>''[http://www.commonlii.org/int/cases/EngR/1860/307.pdf Cumming v Shand]'' (1860) 5 H&N 95. See also: ''Re European Bank, Agra Bank Claims'' (1872) LR 8 Ch App 41; ''Garnett v McKewan'' (1872) LR 8 Ex 10</ref> (and probably longer). However it was not until 1975 in the House of Lords decision in ''[[National Westminster Bank Ltd v Halesowen Presswork & Assemblies Ltd]]'' [1972] AC 785 that it was finally determined that this was a type of [[set-off (law)|set-off right]] rather than anything related to the [[banker's lien]] (a separate common law right). Typically the right will be exercised where one account is overdrawn and the other is in credit so that the bank can secure full repayment of overdraft without the need to take any further action with respect to the customer. The broad rationale is that separate numbered accounts are set up for administrative convenience only, but the legal duty upon a bank to "account" to its customers for the sums held by it only extends to the net sum.
==Mutuality==
In order for the bank to combine accounts there must be mutuality, i.e. it must be the same customer and the same legal entity for the bank.<ref>''Greenwood Teale v William, William, Brown & Co'' (1894) 11 TLR 56</ref> However, accounts held at different branches of the same bank may still be combined. Although it has not been finally determined by case law, most commentators accept that accounts in different currencies may be combined, as may accounts in different countries (so long as the governing law in each country permits such combination).<ref name=Ellinger />
==Bars to combining accounts== There are various grounds set out in the case law which indicate when an account may not be combined. * '''Agreement to forbear'''. An agreement by the bank not to combine accounts will be binding, possible even in the absence of any consideration. If not an express time, then it will generally be implied that a material change in circumstances would terminate such an agreement (in ''Halesowen'' it was held that calling a meeting of creditors would constitute such circumstances, but in Australia it has been held that appointing a receiver did not.<ref name=Aus>''Direct Acceptances Corp v Bank of NSW'' (1968) 88 WN (NSW) (Pt 1) 498</ref> * '''Money held for specific purpose'''. In line with the authorities on [[Quistclose trusts in English law|''Quistclose'' trusts]], if money is held by the bank for a specific purpose, then it is impressed by a trust and is not subject to combination.<ref>''WP Greenhalgh & Sons v Union Bank of Manchester'' [1924] 2 KB 153</ref> * '''Money held on trust'''. Where the customer holds the money in the account as trustee and so is not beneficially entitled to it, it cannot be combined.<ref>''Union Bank of Australia v Murray-Aynsley'' [1898] AC 693</ref> However, it appears that the reverse is not true - if a trust account is overdrawn then the bank can combine that with a trustee's personal account because the trustee is personally liable for the obligations of the trust.<ref name=Can>''Daniels v Imperial Bank of Canada'' (1914) 19 DLR 166</ref> * '''Where account is subject to a [[security interest]]'''. Provided the security interest is fixed and not [[floating charge|floating]], this will prevent combination of accounts.<ref>''Biggerstaff v Rowatt's Wharf Ltd'' [1896] 2 Ch 93; ''NW Robbie & Co Ltd v Witney Warehouse Co Ltd'' [1963] 1 WLR 1324</ref> * '''Where one account is a loan account'''. This is considered further below.
==Loan accounts== There is a distinct line of authority which indicates that where one of the accounts is a loan account then the bank cannot exercise its rights to combine accounts. Most of the authorities relating to this are older cases,<ref>''Re EJ Morel (1934) Ltd'' [1962] Ch 21; ''Bradford Old Bank v Sutcliffe'' [1918] 2 KB 833</ref> but the rule was applied more recently in ''Fraser v Oystertec plc'' [2006] 1 BCLC 491.
Although slightly anachronistic, the rationale appears to be that the customer of the bank should not be at risk of the bank combining a short-term current account on which the customer writes cheques for daily expenses with a long-term loan account which is not due for repayment until some future time. In practice, most loan agreements will usually give the bank a contractual right to set-off in any event.<ref name=Ellinger />
==Notice== Although there is one case which argues to the contrary, the orthodox position is that the bank does not need to give the customer notice prior to exercising a right to combine accounts.<ref name=Halesowen /><ref name=Sing>''Good Property Land Development Pte Ltd v Société Générale'' [1996] 2 SLR 239 at 250</ref>
==Insolvency== If the bank does not exercise a right to combine accounts prior to a company going into insolvent liquidation, then insolvency set-off will operate automatically, and the insolvency set-off rules will prevail over the bank's right to combine accounts.<ref name=Halesowen>''[[National Westminster Bank Ltd v Halesowen Presswork & Assemblies Ltd]]'' [1972] AC 785</ref>
==Foreign countries== The banker's right to combine accounts has been recognised at appellate level by the courts of various other [[common law jurisdictions]], including Australia,<ref name=Aus /> Canada,<ref name=Can /> Guyana<ref>''British Guiana Bank v OR'' (1911) 104 LT 754 (PC)</ref> and Singapore.<ref name=Sing /> However, there does not appear to be any corresponding general right in civil law jurisdictions outside of the conventional right of [[set-off (law)|set-off]].
==External links== * [http://www.lawteacher.net/free-law-essays/contract-law/a-bankers-right-to-set-off-money-contract-law-essay.php A banker's right to set off money]
==Footnotes== {{reflist|30em}}
[[Category:United Kingdom business law]] [[Category:Bank account]]

{{Infobox person | name = Brett Blundy | image = <!--Brett-Blundy.jpg--> | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth based on age as of date |58|2018|09|28}}<ref name="Forbes profile"/> | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | residence = Singapore | citizenship = Australia | occupation = Businessman | net_worth = US$1.3 billion (September 2018)<ref name="Forbes profile">{{cite web |title=Forbes profile: Brett Blundy |url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/brett-blundy/#69eebe6c6d91 |website=Forbes |accessdate=28 September 2018}}</ref> | title = CEO and Founder, [[BB Retail Capital]] | spouse = Vanessa Speer<ref>{{cite news|title=Brett Blundy’s BridgeClimb too far for ASX float list|url=http://www.theaustralian.com.au/business/margin-call/brett-blundys-bridgeclimb-too-far-for-asx-float-list/news-story/7cbfbee059520ad2759b3f4d8e73212a |accessdate=17 March 2017 |work=The Weekend Australian |date=10 September 2015}}</ref> | children = 2 }}
'''Brett Blundy''' (born 1959/1960) is an Australian [[billionaire]] businessman. He is the [[chairman]] of [[BB Retail Capital]], which owns companies such as [[Sanity Entertainment]], Bras N Things, and Aventus Property Group.<ref name="Financial Review">{{cite news|title=Billionaire Brett Blundy's retail recipe that made his executives millions|url=http://www.afr.com/brand/boss/billionaire-brett-blundys-magnificent-seven-20160911-grdyuf|accessdate=16 March 2017|work=Financial Review|date=26 October 2016}}</ref><ref name="Aventus">{{cite web|title=Aventus Property Group — Specialist Fund and Asset Manager|url=http://aventusproperty.com.au/about|website=Aventus Property|accessdate=16 March 2017}}</ref> He is part-owner of [[BridgeClimb Sydney]], one of Australia's biggest [[Tourist attraction|tourist attractions]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.afr.com/lifestyle/bridgeclimb-profits-cheer-hungry-jack-cowin-and-brett-blundy-but-heres-why-singo-wont-be-smiling-20131107-jybb2|title=BridgeClimb profits cheer Hungry Jack Cowin and Brett Blundy, but here’s why Singo won’t be smiling|date=2013-11-12|work=Financial Review|access-date=2017-03-17|language=en-US}}</ref>
== Career == BBRC was founded by Blundy in 1980<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbrcworld.com/about-us/|title=BBRC {{!}} About Us|website=www.bbrcworld.com|language=en-AU|access-date=2017-03-17}}</ref> with the purchase of a single [[Record shop|record store]] "Disco Duck",<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://blogs.wsj.com/dealjournalaustralia/2013/04/08/australian-millionaire-brett-blundy-moves-to-singapore/|title=Australian Millionaire Brett Blundy Moves to Singapore|last=Tan|first=Gillian|date=2013-04-08|website=WSJ|access-date=2017-03-17}}</ref> now known as [[Sanity (music store)|Sanity Entertainment Group]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.lifestyleasia.com/1930/exclusive-photos-cloud-9-200-ft-super-yacht/|title=Exclusive photos: Cloud 9 200-ft super yacht - LifestyleAsia Singapore|website=www.lifestyleasia.com|language=en-US|access-date=2017-03-17}}</ref>
In 2005, he purchased Diva, a fashion jewellery store founded by Colette and Mark Hayman. Diva had close to 200 stores in Australia and New Zealand and 400 in international markets.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.smartcompany.com.au/growth/42143-what-s-happening-at-diva-confusion-over-future-of-australian-fashion-accessories-chain/|title=What’s happening at Diva? Confusion over future of Australian fashion accessories chain - SmartCompany|last=Keating|first=Eloise|date=2014-05-28|work=SmartCompany|access-date=2017-03-17|language=en-AU}}</ref>
In 2010, he launched Lovisa, a fast fashion jewellery brand.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbrcworld.com/retail/|title=BBRC {{!}} Retail|website=www.bbrcworld.com|language=en-AU|access-date=2017-03-17}}</ref> Lovisa is now has over 270 stores worldwide.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.lovisa.com.au/our-brand/|title=Our Brand|website=www.lovisa.com.au|language=en-AU|access-date=2017-03-17}}</ref>
Early 2018 Bras n Things was sold to the US company [[Hanes]] (ex Pacific Brands).<ref>{{cite news |author=Carrie LaFrenz |date=9 February 2018 |title=Brett Blundy offloads Bras N Things to Hanes for $500m |url=https://www.afr.com/business/retail/clothing-and-accessories/brett-blundy-offloads-brasnthings-to-hanes-for-500m-20180208-h0vt9e |newspaper=The Australian Financial Review |accessdate=29 September 2018}}</ref>
==Personal life== He is married, with two children, and lives in [[Singapore]].<ref name="Forbes profile"/>
Blundy owns a 242-foot megayacht, ''Cloud 9''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://uk.businessinsider.com/monaco-yacht-show-billionaire-yachts-photos-2018-9?r=US&IR=T/#cloud-9-3|title=9 outrageous yachts appearing at the Monaco Yacht Show owned by some of the world's richest billionaires|author=|date=|website=businessinsider.com|accessdate=28 September 2018}}</ref>
==External links== * [http://www.bbrcworld.com/ BB Retail Capital]
==References== {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Blundy, Brett}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Australian businesspeople]] [[Category:Australian billionaires]]
{{australia-bio-stub}}

{{Coord|37|31|3.2|N|76|58|42.3|W|display=title}}
[[File:Chestnut Grove (plantation).jpg|thumb|left|200px|Chestnut Grove plantation where Martha Washington, wife of George Washington, was born.]] '''Chestnut Grove''' was an 18th-century [[Plantation house in the Southern United States|plantation house]] on the [[Pamunkey River]] near [[New Kent, Virginia|New Kent Court House]] in [[New Kent County, Virginia|New Kent County]], [[Virginia]], [[United States]].<ref name=MW2>{{cite book |title=Martha Washington: First Lady of the United States |last=Haugen |first=Brenda |authorlink= |coauthors= |year= 2005 |publisher=Compass Point Books |location= |isbn=0-7565-0983-1 |page= |pages= |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=7sCG4rjdckkC }}</ref><ref name=DHR>{{cite web | url=http://www.dhr.virginia.gov/hiway_markers/marker.cfm?mid=3633 | title=Martha Washington's Birthplace | date= | accessdate=2008-03-05 | publisher=Virginia Department of Historic Resources | author=Virginia Department of Historic Resources}}</ref> Chestnut Grove is best known as the [[place of birth|birthplace]] of [[Martha Washington]],<ref name=MW2/><ref name=DHR/><ref name=CW>{{cite web | url=http://www.history.org/Almanack/people/bios/biomwash.cfm | title=Martha Dandridge Custis Washington | year=2009 | accessdate=2008-03-05 | publisher=The Colonial Williamsburg Foundation | author=[[Colonial Williamsburg|The Colonial Williamsburg Foundation]]}}</ref><ref name=MW>{{cite book |title=Martha Washington: First Lady of Liberty |last=Bryan |first=Helen |authorlink= |coauthors= |year= 2002 |publisher=John Wiley and Sons, Inc. |location=[[Hoboken, New Jersey|Hoboken]], [[New Jersey]] |isbn=0-471-15892-5 |page= |pages= |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=aM9jR3aJZKUC }}</ref> wife of [[George Washington]], and the first [[First Lady of the United States]]. Martha Washington was born in the east room of the mansion.<ref name=MW2/><ref name=MW/>
==History== The two-story frame house consisting of six rooms<ref name=DHR/><ref name=MW/> was originally built around 1730.<ref name=MW/> It was first inhabited by prominent Virginia [[Planter (American South)|planter]] [[John Dandridge]] and his wife [[Frances Jones (mother of Martha Dandridge Washington)|Frances Jones]].<ref name=MW2/><ref name=DHR/><ref name=MW/> The couple raised their eight children, including [[Martha Washington]], there.<ref name=MW2/><ref name=DHR/><ref name=MW/> It was at Chestnut Grove that Martha married her first husband, [[Daniel Parke Custis]], on 15 May 1750.<ref name=MW2/><ref name=DHR/><ref name=MW/>
In 1768, Martha Washington's younger brother [[Bartholomew Dandridge]] sold Chestnut Grove and its accompanying {{convert|500|acre|km2}}.<ref name=MW/> Colonel Richard Pye Cooke then purchased the mansion in 1840.<ref name=CV>{{cite web | url=http://webpages.charter.net/chamberlayne/history/part2.htm | title=The Third Generation and Beyond: The Late 18th to the Mid-19th Century | date=July 13, 2003 | accessdate=2008-03-05 | publisher=The Chamberlaynes of Virginia | author=Philip J. Chamberlain, Ph.D. | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080820022457/http://webpages.charter.net/chamberlayne/history/part2.htm | archivedate=August 20, 2008 | df= }}</ref> At that time, the Chestnut Grove estate contained {{convert|1175|acre|km2}}. Unlike neighboring plantation homes, Chestnut Grove continued to serve as a residence for 200 years in its original state until it burned down in November 1926.<ref name=DHR/><ref name=MW/>
==Architecture== Chestnut Grove's architectural details survive due to old photographs and sketches.<ref name=MW/> The mansion was a two-story frame structure with a [[hip roof]] and a chimney at either end.<ref name=MW/> It also contained a [[basement]] which ran the length of the mansion.<ref name=MW/> The interior of Chestnut Grove was plain and paneled in pine.<ref name=MW/>
==References== {{reflist|2}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Chestnut Grove (Plantation)}} [[Category:Houses in New Kent County, Virginia]] [[Category:Dandridge family of Virginia]] [[Category:Plantation houses in Virginia]] [[Category:Burned houses in the United States]]
