revision.text:
{{for|the field hockey player|Daniel Beale (field hockey)}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2012}} {{Use British English|date=August 2012}} [[File:Daniel Beale (1759–1842) and Elizabeth Barbot memorial, St Pancras New Church, February 2015 01.jpg|thumb|Daniel Beale and Elizabeth Barbot memorial, [[St Pancras New Church]], London]]
'''Daniel Beale''' (1759–1842) was a Scottish merchant and fur trader active in the Far East mercantile centres of [[Bombay]], [[Canton (Guangzhou)|Canton]] and [[Macau]] as well as at one time the [[Prussia]]n consul in China.
==Biography== Daniel Beale was the purser of, successively, the East India Company ships ''Walpole'' and ''General Coote'' on voyages between London and Canton in 1783-1786: in 1783 he joined the Macao partnership of [[John Henry Cox]] and John Reid in their mercantile ventures.<ref>Robert J. King, "John Meares: Dubliner, Naval Officer, Fur Trader and would be Colonizer", ''Journal of Australian Naval History,'' vol.8, no.1, March 2011, pp.32-62, n.34.</ref> Giving evidence before the British parliament’s commons committee of ''Enquiry on the East India Company’s Affairs'' on 11 May 1815, Beale testified that he had been resident in Canton "from the latter end of 1787 to the middle of 1797"<ref name="PCE">{{Cite book|title= The parliamentary debates from the year 1803 to the present time}} [https://books.google.com/books?id=yyfauGAhTpcC&pg=RA5-PT213 Online version at Google Books].</ref> and acted as "agent for many of the mercantile houses in Bombay and [[Bengal]]."
[[John Henry Cox]] had been sent to Canton in 1782 by his father James to sell off an accumulated stock of clocks, watches and mechanical toys<ref name=RIDE> {{Cite book|last1=Ride|first1=Lindsay|first2=May|last2=Ride|first3=Bernard (ed.)|last3=Mellor | title=An East India company cemetery: Protestant burials in Macao | year=1996 | publisher=Hong Kong Univ Press | isbn=978-962-209-384-3 }} [https://books.google.com/books?id=flbXWNoVraEC&printsec=frontcover#v=onepage&q&f=false Online version at Google books] p. 13</ref> known in Pidgin English as "singsongs", which were popular with the Chinese. Along with James Fox, the other major manufacturer of singsongs was Francis Magniac of Clerkenwell, London, whose sons Charles and [[Hollingworth Magniac|Hollingworth]] would later become partners of Beale.<ref name="GREENBERG">{{Cite book|last=Greenberg|first=Michael|title= British trade and the opening of China 1800-1842|publisher= Monthly Review Press; First Edition (1 January 1951)|isbn= 978-0-85345-497-7}} [https://books.google.com/books?id=QNo8AAAAIAAJ&pg=PA76 Online version at Google Books]</ref>
Merchants operating in the Far East at this time formed a bewildering array of partnerships. As well as the Coxes, Beale was also at various times a partner of John Reid, Charles Magniac and his brother Hollingworth, as well as Alexander Shank and Robert Hamilton.<ref name="CONNELL"> {{Cite book |last=Matheson Connell|first=Carol|title=A Business in Risk – Jardine Matheson and the Hong Kong Trading Industry|publisher=Praeger|year=2004|isbn=978-0-275-98035-1}} p. 7 [https://books.google.com/books?id=TOOCn-yBRWoC&printsec=frontcover&dq=A+Business+in+Risk+%E2%80%93+Jardine+Matheson+and+the+Hong+Kong+Trading+Industry&source=bl&ots=KgTVaoEtfL&sig=1RVa6TsN03S9PJfFi263akYu58U&hl=zh-CN&ei=gqufTfK_B4SXcfysycAP&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=2&ved=0CCIQ6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q&f=false Online version at Google books]</ref>
On 15 February 1786, a [[Prussia]]n ship arrived at [[Huangpu District, Guangzhou|Whampoa]] whereupon the [[East India Company]]’s agent at [[Canton (Guangzhou)|Canton]] informed the Committee of [[Supercargo]]es that Beale had shown him a letter signed by "Count Lusi, Envoy Extraordinaire to his Majesty the King of Prussia with the King of Great Britain and his Colonel of Infantry", announcing his appointment as his Prussian Majesty’s Consul in China.<ref>’’[[The Gentleman's Magazine]]’’ (1798) Volume 58, Page 555 [https://books.google.com/books?id=zk4DAAAAMAAJ&pg=PA555 Online version at Google Books]</ref>
Beale was also a member of the Associated Merchants Trading to the Northwest Coast of America, which owned the [[snow (ship)|snow]] ''Iphigenia Nubiana'', trading on this coast in 1788 and 1789. Other partners in the venture were [[John Meares]], [[John Henry Cox]], Richard C. Etches, John W. Etches, William Fitzhugh and Henry Land.<ref>Dalzell , Kathleen ‘’Queen Charlotte Islands - Book 2: of places and names’’ Prince Rupert: Cove Press, 1973.</ref> Along with fellow Scotsman [[John Reid (merchant)|John Reid]], Beale was also one of the owners of the [[Imperial Eagle (ship)|Imperial Eagle]], a vessel ostensibly belonging to the fictitious Austrian East India Company, which sailed under the flag of Austria. This allowed her to circumvent the trade monopoly then held by the East India Company. Beale was by this time the Prussian agent in Canton following his earlier appointment as consul. Beale organized the voyage of the ''Imperial Eagle'' when he returned to London from Canton on the HCS ''General Coote'' in August 1786.<ref>Louis Dermigny, ''La Chine et L’Occident,'' Paris, SEVPEN, 1964, tome III, p.1241.</ref>
By 1797, Beale & Co. had become the biggest of the country traders, dealing with clients in Bombay, Calcutta and London, in Indian cotton, sandalwood, tin, pepper Chinese tea and silk as well as opium.<ref>{{Cite book|last=Coates|first=Austin|title= Macao and the British, 1637-1842|publisher=China; OUP|isbn= 978-0-19-582782-8}} p. 73, pp. 128ff</ref> His firm Beale & Co. seems to have been active in the opium trade between 1783–1793.
In 1797 Daniel Beale left China to join Magniac & Co. in London and in 1800 the sole British firm in Canton is recorded as Reid, Beale & Co., formerly Hamilton & Reid, and in 1804 to become Beale & Magniac.<ref name="GREENBERG" />
==Memorial== Beale died in England in 1842. In the gallery of [[St Pancras New Church]], London, there is a memorial to Thomas Beale of [[Fitzroy Square]] and of Millfield House [[Edmonton, London|Edmonton]], Middlesex. formerly of Canton and Macao, "a most zealous promoter of the building of this Church and one of the original trustees."<ref name="SOL">[http://www.british-history.ac.uk/report.aspx?compid=65559 ''Survey of London: volume 24: The parish of St Pancras part 4: King’s Cross Neighbourhood'' (1952), pp. 1–9.]</ref>
He was immortalised by the artist [[Jacques-Laurent Agasse]] in his painting ''Daniel Beale at his Farm at Edmonton with his Favourite Horse''.<ref name ="SOUTH">{{Cite web|url=http://www.invaluable.com/auction-lot/f-jacques-laurent-agasse-1767-1849-1-c-860tjei64d|title=Sotheby’s Auction Item|year=2005|accessdate=2 June 2011}}</ref>
==Family== In 1791 he married Elizabeth, the daughter of Paul Barbot of London.<ref name="SOUTH" /> She died in 1830.<ref name="SOL" />
They had a son, also named Daniel, who was born about 1798 and died on 4 January 1827 aged 29, as well as a younger brother, [[Thomas Beale]], and a cousin, [[Thomas Chaye Beale]].<ref name="OPC">{{Cite web| url=http://gwulo.com/sites/gwulo.com/files/Gwulo-Macau-Old-Protestant-Cemetery.pdf|title=Old Protestant Cemetery in Macau|accessdate=31 May 2011}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist|2}}
{{Foreign trade in Imperial China |state=collapsed}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Beale, Daniel}} [[Category:Scottish businesspeople]] [[Category:History of foreign trade in China]] [[Category:1759 births]] [[Category:1842 deaths]]

revision.comment: lead format fix
revision.text:
'''Data warehouse automation''' ('''DWA''') refers to the process of accelerating and automating the [[data warehouse]] development cycles, while assuring quality and consistency. DWA is believed to provide automation of the entire lifecycle of a data warehouse, from source [[Systems analysis|system analysis]] to [[Software testing|testing]] to [[documentation]]. It helps improve productivity, reduce cost, and improve overall quality.<ref>{{cite web|title=Automate and accelerate your data transformations|url=http://www.attunity.com/products/prepare-data-compose|website=www.attunity.com|publisher=Attunity|accessdate=7 December 2015}}</ref>
==General== Data warehouse automation primarily focuses on automation of each and every step involved in the lifecycle of a data warehouse, thus reducing the efforts required in managing it.<ref>{{cite web|title=New Buzzword! Data Warehouse Automation|url=http://blogs.jetreports.com/2015/03/05/new-buzzword-data-warehouse-automation/|website=blogs.jetreports.com|publisher=jetreports|accessdate=7 December 2015}}</ref> Data warehouse automation works on the principles of design patterns. It comprises a central repository of design patterns, which encapsulate architectural standards as well as best practices for data design, data management, data integration, and data usage.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.wherescape.com/media/1988/data-warehouse-automation-decision-guide.pdf|title=Data Warehouse Automation - A Decision Guide|website=www.wherescape.com|publisher=David L. Wells, Infocentric LLC|accessdate=7 December 2015}}</ref> In November 2015, an analyst firm has published a guide ''Which Data Warehouse Automation Tool is Right for You?'' covering four of the leading products in the DWA space.<ref>{{cite web|title=Which Data Warehouse Automation Tool is Right for You?|url=http://eckerson.com/register?content=which-data-warehouse-automation-tool-is-right-for-you|website=eckerson.com|publisher= Wayne Eckerson|accessdate=9 December 2015}}</ref> In November 2015, an international software and technology services company engaged in developing ‘agile tools’ for the data integration industry, was named by CIO Review as one of the 20 most promising productivity tools solution providers 2015 <ref>{{cite web|title=CIO Magazine Award - 20 Most promising productivity tools|url=http://analytixds.com/latest_news/analytix-data-services-wins-cio-reviews-2015/|website=www.analtyixds.com|publisher=AnalytiX DS|accessdate=25 November 2016}}</ref>
==Benefits== Data warehouse automation can provide advantages like source data exploration, warehouse data models, ETL generation, test automation, metadata management, managed deployment, scheduling, change impact analysis and easier maintenance and modification of the data warehouse.<ref>{{cite web|title=Data Warehouse Automation (DWA)?|url=http://www.timextender.com/software/data-warehouse-automation/business-value/|website=timextender.com|publisher=TimeXtender Software 2015|accessdate=7 December 2015}}</ref> More important than the technical features of DWA tools, however, is the ability to deliver projects faster and with less resources.<ref>{{cite web|title=Deliver Faster|url=http://kalido.com/products/kalido-information-engine/deliver-faster/|website=kalido.com|publisher=Magnitude Software|accessdate=9 December 2015}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * {{Dmoz|Computers/Software/Databases/Data_Warehousing/Data_Warehouse_Automation|Data Warehouse Automation}} * [http://analytixds.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/analytix-data-services-top-20-cio-review.pdf CIO Magazine Award - 20 Most promising productivity tools 'CIO Review', November 10, 2015]
==See also== *[[Data warehouse]] *[[Data mart]] *[[Data warehouse appliance]] *[[Data integration]]
{{Data_warehouse}}
[[Category:Data management]] [[Category:Data warehousing]]

page.title: Electronic process of law in Brazil

revision.comment: Rescuing 2 sources and tagging 0 as dead. #IABot (v1.5.2)
revision.text:
{{Main|Electronic process of law}} '''Electronic process of law'''<ref name="NYT">{{cite web|url=http://jcrs.uol.com.br/site/noticia.php?codn=72078|title=Processo Eletrônico|author=Lisboa, E|publisher=The New York Times Company|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref><ref name="RVN">{{cite web|url=http://www.24horasnews.com.br/index.php?mat=386042|title=Portal do Poder Judiciário disponibiliza informações sobre o PJe|publisher=Redação 24hs News|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref><ref name="RD">{{cite web|url=http://www.rondoniadinamica.com/arquivo/processo-eletronico-do-tcu-e-apresentado-a-membros-e-tecnicos-do-tce,28589.shtml |title=Processo eletrônico do TCU é apresentado a membros e técnicos do TCE |publisher=Rondônia Dinâmica |accessdate=1 October 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140316080454/http://www.rondoniadinamica.com/arquivo/processo-eletronico-do-tcu-e-apresentado-a-membros-e-tecnicos-do-tce,28589.shtml |archivedate=16 March 2014 |df= }}</ref> is a nowadays phenomenon, related to the use of computer systems in courts and other public departments in their procedural activities.<ref name="FB">{{cite web|url=http://www.floridabar.org/DIVCOM/PI/RHandbook01.nsf/1119bd38ae090a748525676f0053b606/5192d3660a0dd573852569cb004c8e15!OpenDocument|title=Cameras in the Courtroom|publisher=The Florida Bar|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref>
== System and applications of electronic process == [[Information system]]s<ref name="EAT">{{cite web|url=http://www.knoow.net/cienceconempr/gestao/sistinform.htm|title=Conceito de Sistemas de Informação|author=Enciclopédia de Artes Temáticas|publisher=Enciclopédia de Artes Temáticas|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref> are not the same as applications.<ref name="RC">{{cite web|url=http://conceito.de/software-aplicativo|title=Conceito de Aplicativo|author=Revista Conceito|publisher=Revista Conceito|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref> Both are sited inside the scope of the generic words meaning of ''software'',<ref name="MUE">{{cite web |url=http://mundoeducacao.uol.com.br/informatica/hardware-software.htm |title=Hardware e Software |author=Dantas, T |publisher=Mundo Uol Educação |accessdate=1 October 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080531154853/http://mundoeducacao.uol.com.br/informatica/hardware-software.htm |archivedate=31 May 2008 |df= }}</ref> Systems are related to structure and paradigm; application to a specific implementation and esthetic and functional elements. Some information systems in Brazil are the [[:pt:PROJUDI|PROJUDI]],<ref name="VC">{{cite web|url=http://www.unipar.br/noticias/2011/09/06/guaira-cisi-sistemas-de-informacao-cria-software-para-o-sajug/ |title=Sistemas de Informação cria software para o Sajug |author=Unipar, Guaíra |publisher=Via Cisi |accessdate=1 October 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131006121849/http://www.unipar.br/noticias/2011/09/06/guaira-cisi-sistemas-de-informacao-cria-software-para-o-sajug/ |archivedate=6 October 2013 |df= }}</ref> the [[Slapsoftware]],<ref name="SLAP">{{cite web|url=http://www.slapsoftware.com.br/|title=Software Livre da Administração Processual|author=Software Livre da Administração Processual|publisher=Software Livre da Administração Processual|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref> the ''e-CNJ'',<ref name="CTEJ">{{cite web |url=http://www.projudibrasil.com.br/sistemas/e-cnj.asp |title=Sistema de Processo Eletrônico e-CNJ |publisher=Constultoria em Tecnologia Empresarial e Jurídica |accessdate=1 October 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111028194111/http://www.projudibrasil.com.br/sistemas/e-cnj.asp |archivedate=28 October 2011 |df= }}</ref> the ''e-STF'',<ref name="STF">{{cite web|url=http://www.stf.jus.br/portal/cms/verTexto.asp?servico=processoPeticaoEletronica|title=Sistema de Processo Eletrônico e-STF|author=Supremo Tribunal Federal|publisher=Portal do Processo Eletrônico|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref> the ''PJe'',<ref name="PJEA">{{cite web|url=http://projetos.csjt.jus.br/sites/docs/PJe/default.aspx|title=Apresentação|author=Processo Judicial Eletrônico|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref> the Themis,<ref name="OABRS">{{cite web|url=http://www.oabrs.org.br/sistema_themis.php |title=Sistema Themis |date=15 November 2005 |publisher=OAB-RS |accessdate=1 October 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111015010105/http://www.oabrs.org.br/sistema_themis.php |archivedate=15 October 2011 |df= }}</ref> SAJ.<ref name="SP">{{cite web|url=http://www.softplan.com.br/saj/index.jsf|title=Sistema de Automação Processual|author=Softplan|publisher=SOFTPLAN|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref> and the Mavenflip .<ref name="Mavenflip">{{cite web|url=http://www.mavenflip.com.br/|title=Visualizador de processo eletrônico|author=Maven Inventing|publisher=Maven Inventing|accessdate=1 October 2013}}</ref> The applications are many and subordinated to the systems, for instance, the ''e-proc''.<ref name="NFLUOL">{{cite web|url=http://jus.com.br/revista/texto/4795/a-virtualizacao-dos-processos-judiciais-e-proc-e-a-dispensabilidade-de-autenticacao-documental-por-tabeliao|title=A virtualização dos processos judiciais (e-proc) e a dispensabilidade de autenticação documental por tabelião|author=Nery, F. L|publisher=UOL|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref>
<!-- == Histórico do processo eletrônico no Brasil == === Primeira fase: o início === O processo eletrônico no sentido amplo, ou seja, o uso do computador no processo, remonta há décadas,<ref name="RPE">{{cite web|url=http://www.processoeletronico.com.br/page003.aspx|title=Breve Retrospecto do Processo Civil|publisher=Revista de Processo Eletrônico|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref> sendo possível identificar algumas iniciativas embrionárias em vários Tribunais do País, as quais foram evoluindo, com o uso posterior de outros sistemas e aplicativos, bem como novas linguagens. Já no sentido estrito não é mais recente a primeira aparição do uso do audio como elemento de autos, inclusive remontando há séculos,<ref name="RJMP">{{cite web|url=http://aplicacao.mp.mg.gov.br/xmlui/bitstream/handle/123456789/263/novas%20perspectivas%20uso%20taquigrafia_Santos.pdf?sequence=1|title=Diálogo Multidisciplinar|publisher=Revista Jurídica do Ministério Público, Vol. 6|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref> caracterizando uma forma eletrônica de armazenamento principal de atos processuais.
=== Segunda fase: a evidência === A fase de maior evidência do ''processo eletrônico'' se iniciou em 2006,<ref name="RD2">{{cite web|url=http://direito2.com/tjgo/2008/jun/20/lenar-destaca-projudi-como-renovacao-para-o-judiciario|title=Lenar destaca Projudi como renovação para o Judiciário|author=TJGO|date=20/06/2008|publisher=Revista Direito2|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref> com o lançamento do projeto [[PROJUDI]], de iniciativa do órgão oficial [[CNJ]]. A partir de então, crescentemente, os Tribunais passaram a apresentar uma maior movimentação de fluxo de informações ao público externo, bem como trabalhos internos, voltados ao desenvolvimento deste ramo da administração, sobretudo a partir do uso do respectivo sistema, com todas as suas implementações (aplicativos) em todo o país, passando pelas fases de teste, produção e uso estável.
=== A fase atual === No momento atual, coexistem diversos sistemas e aplicativos de processos em diversos tribunais. O [[CNJ]]<ref name="CNJPP">{{cite web|url=http://www.cnj.jus.br|title=Página Principal|author=Conselho Nacional de Justiça|publisher=Conselho Nacional de Justiça|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref> vem apresentando o novo projeto [[PJe]], aquele que vem obtendo mais evidência no trânsito de informações e mais ocorrências nas pesquisas relacionadas à atividade atual desta área. O material obtido acerca do projeto afirma ser o mesmo uma soma de esforços e utilizações de vários sistemas já testados no âmbito das Justiças Federal e do Trabalho. Ao mesmo momento, percebe-se a a existência do projeto [[Slapsoftware]], uma iniciativa não governamental de processo eletrônico, que, segundo o material obtido, afirma ser o primeiro sistema a seguir o paradigma de [[software livre]], não contradiz o projeto oficial, propondo uma união de esforços, submetendo-se às determinações do [[CNJ]] quanto ao Judiciário, e até mesmo propondo a fusão com o [[PJe]]. Por outro lado, alguns aplicativos também são desenvolvidos por empresas privadas, autoras de alguns dos sistemas e aplicativos já citados. Aqui se deve registrar uma diferença de paradigma, a saber. O projeto do organismo governamental segue a política que vem buscando, desde o início, de condicionar o uso dos aplicativos desenvolvidos aos processos que têm os autos armazenados em meio eletrônico, ou seja, o processo eletrônico em sentido estrito. Já o [[Slapsoftware]] permite o uso dos mesmos aplicativos para ambas as formas de armazenamento, bem como um modelo misto de participação pública e privada, ou seja, atividades como especificação e parametrização de aplicativos, bem como a distribuição e suporte por parte de empresas privadas.
=== Poder judiciário === Desde 2009, os sistemas e aplicativos no [[Poder Judiciário]], sobretudo os que gerenciam o [[processo judicial]] devem respeitar determinações e recomendações do [[CNJ]].<ref name="CNJCPC">{{cite web|url=http://www.cnj.jus.br/sgt/consulta_publica_classes.php|title=Sistema de Gestão de Tabelas Processuais Unificadas|author=Conselho Nacional de Justiça|publisher=Conselho Nacional de Justiça|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref> Tais [[norma]]s dizem respeito, entre as principais questões, à [[classificação]] de processos e atos para fins [[Estatística|estatísticos]], ou seja, com objetivo de [[controle]] de produtividade, definição de meios de atuação para correções de distorções e diagnósticos em geral das demandas e suas causas. Entre os mecanismos mediatos de classificação está a '''numeração única'''.<ref name="CNJNU">{{cite web|url=http://www.cnj.jus.br/programas-de-a-a-z/eficiencia-modernizacao-e-transparencia/pj-numeracao-unica|title=Numeração Única|author=Conselho Nacional de Justiça|publisher=Conselho Nacional de Justiça|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref>
=== Poderes executivo e legislativo=== É menor o número de informações sobre o desenvolvimento de sistemas processuais neste [[Órgão público|órgãos]], bem como para os processos [[Processo administrativo|administrativos]] e [[Processo legislativo|legislativos]], entretanto, se percebe, a partir de uma minuciosa pesquisa, uma demanda reprimida em relação ao uso de tais sistemas para uma abrangência maior de processos. Embora se trate do mesmo tema, vez por outra tais sistemas vêm sendo referidos como elementos autônomos.<ref name="JNPAE">{{cite web|url=http://jus.com.br/revista/texto/18959/processo-administrativo-eletrônico|title=Processo Administrativo Eletrônico|author=Correa, D. B. R|date=01/07/2010|publisher=Jus Navigandi|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref>
== O processo eletrônico e a empresa privada == A [[iniciativa privada]] participa, com expressiva presença, no mercado destinado ao desenvolvimento de sistemas para processos, tanto os que possuem os autos eletrônicos como aqueles que, no modelo tradicional, são manuseados em papel e registrados e acompanhados pelo sistema.
== Nomes primitivos do processo eletrônico == === Processo virtual === O primeiro nome dado ao ''processo eletrônico'' foi ''processo virtual''. Processo virtual, conceito de [[direito processual civil]],<ref name="PM">{{cite book|title=Comentários ao Código de Processo Civil, Atualizado por Sérgio Bermudes|last=Pontes de Miranda|first=Francisco Cavalcanti|volume=1|pagess=692,1872|publisher=Forense}}</ref> relativo ao tema específico da formação do processo, da [[Ação (direito)|ação]] e da [[lide]], é aquele processo '''eventual''', aquele que pode vir a ser processo ou, enfim, o processo que não existe, senão numa construção hipotética. A conveniência do uso deste nome, decorrente da [[metáfora]] da "navegação virtual", como ato de usar a [[rede mundial de computadores]] logo passou a ser revista e tal denominação foi abandonada. Ainda hoje, entretanto, algumas poucas ocorrências desta expressão são encontradas como denotativas do armazenamento de [[autos]] em [[arquivos]].
=== Processo digital === [[Digital]], uma contraposição a analógico (relógio digital é aquele possui marcações discretas e informa os dados por [[dígito]]s, que são, em última instância, resultante de operações binárias, ao contrário do analógico que marca continuamente). A difusão do computator e da metáfora da "era digital" como a era dos [[bits]] entratanto, acabou por cunhar esta expressão como uma alternativa para o ''processo eletrônico'', como já explanado anteriormente na enumeração dos ''sistemas'' e ''aplicativos''. -->
== Law == In Brazil, since 2006, there is a law dealing about the electronic process,<ref name="LTR">{{cite book|url=http://www.ltreditora.com.br/comentarios-a-lei-do-processo-eletronico.html|title=Comentários à Lei do Processo Eletrônico|last=Chaves Júnior|first=José Eduardo de Resende|publisher=LTR|year=2010}}</ref> it's the Law nº 11419 of 2006, without which there would not be the possibility of the phenomenon in its strict sense, that is the substitution of paper as primary source of information. This law is also important to kill the polemic about the validity of non-traditional communications means in legal procedures enrolled by former rules.
== See also == *[[Lawsuit]] *[[Virtual world]] *[[Audiovisual]] *[[Procedural law]] *[[Judicial power]]
== References == {{Reflist}}
== Bibliography == * Almeida Filho, José Carlos Araújo, ''Processo Eletrônico e Teoria Geral do Processo Eletrônico'', Forense, 2007 * Clementino, Edilberto Barbosa, ''Processo Judicial Eletrônico em Conformidade com a Lei 11.419, de 19/12/2006'', Juruá, 2006
<!-- == Note == {{Translated page|Portuguese|Processo eletrônico no Brazil|28436167}} -->
[[Category:Public administration]] [[Category:Legal software]] [[Category:Government of Brazil]]

revision.comment: fix url
revision.text:
{{italic title}} '''''Ex aequo et bono''''' ([[Latin]] for "according to the right and good" or "from equity and conscience") is a [[List of legal Latin terms|Latin phrase]] that is used as a legal [[technical terminology|term of art]]. In the context of [[arbitration]], it refers to the power of arbitrators to dispense with consideration of the law but consider solely what they consider to be fair and equitable in the case at hand.
Article 38(2) of the [[Statute of the International Court of Justice]] (ICJ) provides that the court may decide cases ''ex aequo et bono'' only if the parties agree.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.icj-cij.org/documents/index.php?p1=4&p2=2&p3=0 |title=Statute of the Court |publisher=International Court of Justice}}</ref> In 1984, the ICJ decided a case using "equitable criteria" in creating a boundary in the Gulf of Maine for Canada and the US.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.icj-cij.org/files/case-related/67/067-19841012-JUD-01-00-EN.pdf |title=Case concerning delimitation of the maritime boundary in the Gulf of Maine Area |publisher=International Court of Justice |date=October 12, 1984}}</ref>
Article 33 of the [[United Nations Commission on International Trade Law]]'s Arbitration Rules (1976)<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uncitral.org/pdf/english/texts/arbitration/arb-rules/arb-rules.pdf |title=UNCITRAL Arbitration Rules |publisher=United Nations Commission on International Trade Law}}</ref> provides that the arbitrators shall consider only the applicable law unless the arbitral agreement allows the arbitrators to consider ''ex aequo et bono'', or [[amiable compositeur]], instead.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.jus.uio.no/lm/un.arbitration.rules.1976/33.html |title=Article 33 – Applicable law, amiable compositeur |work=UNCITRAL Arbitration Rules (1976) United Nations}}</ref> This rule is also expressed in many national and subnational arbitration laws such as section 22 of the Commercial Arbitration Act 1984 (NSW).
On the other hand, the constituent treaty of the Eritrea–Ethiopia Claims Commission explicitly forbids the body from interpreting ''ex aequo et bono''.
==Ex aequo== The phrase '''''ex aequo''''' (without ''et bono'') is used to mean "equally placed", often in the context of competition winners.<ref>''[[The Chambers Dictionary]]'' (1998). [https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=pz2ORay2HWoC&pg=PA561 "ex aequo"], p. 561. {{ISBN|8186062254}}</ref>
==See also== *[[Equity (law)]] – similar concept in [[common law]] jurisdictions *[[Lex mercatoria]]
==Notes== {{reflist|30em}}
==Further reading== * John Bouvier, ''A law dictionary'', Philadelphia, Childs & Peterson, 1858 * Josephine K. Mason, ''[http://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=1553574 The Role of Ex Aequo et Bono in International Border Settlement: A Critique of the Sudanese Abyei Arbitration]'', Social Science Research Network, 2010; 20 Am. Rev. Int'l Arb. 519 (2009). * Christoph Schreuer, `Decisions Ex Aequo et Bono under the ICSID Convention` (1996)
[[Category:Latin legal terminology]] [[Category:Restitution]] [[Category:Arbitration]]
{{Latin-legal-phrase-stub}} {{international-law-stub}}

{{cleanup|date=March 2011}} [[Image:Databar 14 00075678164125.png|thumbnail|GS1 DataBar barcode symbol encoding a GTIN-12 number]] [[Image:Databar-stacked-omni.png|frame|GS1 DataBar Stacked Omni-Directional barcode symbol encoding <tt>'''00123456789012'''</tt>]]
'''GS1 DataBar''' is a family of symbols most commonly seen in the [[GS1 DataBar Coupon]]. Formerly known as Reduced Space Symbology (RSS-14), this family of [[barcodes]] include:
* Symbols intended for retail [[point of sale]] scanning: ** GS1 DataBar Omnidirectional ** GS1 DataBar Stacked Omnidirectional ** GS1 DataBar Expanded ** GS1 DataBar Expanded Stacked * Symbols that are not intended for retail Point-of-Sale scanning: ** GS1 DataBar Truncated ** GS1 DataBar Limited ** GS1 DataBar Stacked
All GS1 DataBar barcodes encode a GTIN-12 or GTIN-13 in a 14-digit data structure. In order to make the GTIN-12 or GTIN-13 a 14-digit data structure, a leading zero or zeros is filled to the left of the GTIN. GS1 DataBar Omnidirectional, GS1 DataBar Stacked Omnidirectional, GS1 DataBar Expanded, and GS1 DataBar Expanded Stacked have omnidirectional scanning capability. GS1 DataBar Truncated, GS1 DataBar Stacked and GS1 DataBar Limited can only be scanned by a linear hand held or imaging scanning device: they cannot be scanned by omnidirectional scanners and are intended to be read by handheld scanners.
GS1 DataBar Stacked Omnidirectional is designed to condense the GTIN information into a more compact and square barcode suitable for use on smaller packages (such as the label stickers on fresh produce).
GS1 DataBar Limited, GS1 DataBar Stacked and GS1 DataBar Truncated are designed for very small item identification and are mainly used in the [[healthcare industry]]. Each encodes a GTIN-12 or GTIN-13 in 14-digit data structure. Only GS1 DataBar Limited uses an indicator digit 1.
In addition to encoding Application Identifier (01) GTIN, GS1 DataBar Expanded and GS1 DataBar Expanded Stacked can encode additional GS1 Application Identifiers such as [[shelf life|sell-by date]], weight, and lot number. Each symbol has a capacity of up to 74 characters. These attributes can help in controlling [[shrinkage (accounting)|shrinkage]], optimizing product replenishment, and improving the traceability of a product at the point of sale. They are seeing increased use in manufacturers' coupons. Starting June 2011 GS1 Databar use is mandated for coupons and the use of UPC-A must be discontinued.<ref>http://www.honeywellaidc.com/promos/0710_Ask_the_Expert_landing/images/61510GS1DataBarPres_20100709T175210Z.pdf</ref>
The symbology is formally defined as ISO/IEC 24724:2006.
The name was changed from RSS to GS1 DataBar due to the potential for confusion with [[Really Simple Syndication]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.gs1.org/docs/media_centre/gs1_pr_270207_RSS_now_called_GS1_DataBar.pdf |title=Reduced Space Symbology (RSS) is now called GS1 DataBar |author=Eric Decroix |publisher=GS1 Global Office (press release)|date=2007-02-27 |accessdate=2007-03-17 }}</ref>
None of the above is true.
==References== {{reflist}} * GS1 General Specifications
==External links== * [https://www.gs1.org/barcodes/databar GS1 DataBar Information at GS1] * [http://www.databar-barcode.info Overview of GS1 Databar and Databar Coupons] * [http://mdn.morovia.com/manuals/databar-fontware/ch02.php#N1018B An overview of DataBar symbologies]
{{Barcodes}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Gs1 Databar}} [[Category:Barcodes]]
{{business-stub}}

{{primary sources|date=April 2014}} {{Infobox company | name = General Retailers and Traders Union | type = | traded_as = | predecessor = | successor = | founder = Anthony Grixti | defunct = <!-- {{End date|YYYY|MM|DD}} --> | fate = | area_served = | key_people = | industry = Voluntary Association | products = | production = | services = | net_income = | num_employees = | parent = | divisions = | subsid = | homepage = [http://www.grtu.org.mt/ Official website] | footnotes = | romanized = | former type = | foundation = 1948 | location_city = [[Valletta]] | location_country = Malta<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.grtu.org.mt/data/ |title=GRTU Official site |accessdate=December 5, 2016 |publisher=''GRTU''}}</ref> | bodystyle = }} '''General Retailers and Traders Union''' (GRTU), or Association of General Retailers and Traders, is an [[Voluntary association|association]] of [[Small business|small- and medium-sized businesses]] in [[Malta]]. It has over 7,000 members coming from 12,000 different business outlets.
It represents the small business community on bodies such as the Malta Council for Economic Development, the Planning Authority, the Advisory Board of the National Organisation, the Fruit and Vegetables Board, the Commission for the Self Employed, the Council for Consumer Affairs and the Traffic Control Board.
==References== {{Reflist}} *[http://www.maltamedia.com/news/budget/2003/before.shtml MaltaMedia: Proposals from Unions and other bodies] Includes budgetary proposals from GRTU

{{refimprove|date=March 2015}} {{EngvarB|date=May 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2014}} {{Infobox company | name = IGATE Corporation | type = subsidiary | fate = acquired by [[Capgemini]] | defunct = 2015 | logo = IGATE-Logo.png | foundation = 1996<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ir.igate.com/investors/secfiling.cfm?filingID=1193125-13-111548&CIK=1024732|title=iGATE Corporation - Annual Report|work=igate.com|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203014716/http://ir.igate.com/investors/secfiling.cfm?filingID=1193125-13-111548&CIK=1024732|archivedate=3 December 2013|df=dmy-all}}</ref> | location = [[Bridgewater, New Jersey]], U.S. | area_served = North America, Europe, Japan & Australia | key_people = [[Sunil Wadhwani]] (Co-Founder)<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=120380&privcapId=45821899|title=Bloomberg: Sunil Wadhwani Profile|work=Bloomberg}}</ref>
[[Ashok Trivedi]] (Co-Founder)<ref>{{cite web|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/venture-capital/igate-co-founder-trivedi-floats-500m-family-office/articleshow/56194105.cms|title=iGate Co-Founder Trivedi Floats $500m Family Office|work=Times of India}}</ref> [[Srinivas Kandula]] (Chief Executive Officer)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2013-09-12/news/42011774_1_igate-appoints-sunil-wadhwani-ceo-phaneesh-murthy|title=IGATE appoints Ashok Vemuri as president and CEO|work=The Economic Times}}</ref> | num_employees = 31,453 (March, 2015) | industry = [[IT service management|IT services]], [[Information technology|BPO]] | services = IT and Outsourcing services | revenue = {{profit}} US$ 1.27 billion (2014)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.igate.com/about-us/overview|title=About Capgemini - Capgemini Worldwide|work=Capgemini Capgemini Worldwide|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150120172444/http://www.igate.com/about-us/overview|archivedate=20 January 2015|df=dmy-all}}</ref> | parent = [[Capgemini]] | homepage = {{URL|http://www.igate.com/}} }}
'''IGATE''' was an IT '''services''' company, headquartered in [[Bridgewater, New Jersey]], United States. The firm operated in North America, Asia, Europe, Japan and Australia, providing technology consultancy and services. Its revenues in 2014 were over US$1.2 billion, and it has a workforce of over 31,000. The firm had over 70 offices and customer delivery centers in North America, Europe, Asia and Australia. On April 27, 2015 French IT services group [[Capgemini]] unveiled a deal to acquire IGATE in a $4bn deal.<ref name="FT">{{cite web|url=http://www.ft.com/fastft/313742/capgemini-buy-igate |title=Capgemini to buy IGATE in $4bn deal |publisher=FT |date=27 April 2015}}</ref>
== History == Under the [[Companies Act 2013|Companies Act]], 1956, iGate was originally incorporated as ''Mascot Systems Private Limited'' in 1993, and later renamed Mascot Systems Limited. It was formerly a subsidiary of Mastech Systems Corporation, now [[Mastech Digital]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/capgemini-technology-services-india-ltd/infocompanyhistory/companyid-3695.cms|title=Capgemini Technology Services India Information - The Economic Times|last=|first=|date=|website=economictimes.indiatimes.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-04-23}}</ref>
In 2011, IGATE, acquired Patni Computer Systems–a company three times its size at the time.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/technology/igate-completes-patni-acquisition-111051300074_1.html |title= IGATE completes Patni acquisition |publisher=Business Standard |date=13 May 2011}}</ref> With a value of around a billion US dollars, this acquisition was the largest cross-border leveraged transaction in the IT sector.{{citation needed|date=March 2015}} The acquisition was accomplished over 12 months, including the delisting of Patni from the Indian bourses and consolidating the shareholder value in the U.S.{{citation needed|date=May 2014}} Initially. iGATE firm changed its name to iGATE Patni. It was changed to IGATE again on 7 May 2012. Its shares are listed on the [[NYSE]] as "IGATE". On 27 April 2015, Capgemini announced it would be acquiring IGATE, the transition would be completed over a phase of 6 months. IGATE CEO Ashok Vemuri announced his departure on 6 October 2015.<ref name="FT" />
==Key services== IGATE's key services included [[Software development|Application Development]] and Application Maintenance, [[Business Intelligence]] and [[Analytics]], [[Business Process Outsourcing]], [[Cloud computing|Cloud Services]], Enterprise Mobility, Infrastructure Management Services, P&ES Embedded systems, Product Verification and Validation(P&ES), and [[Verification & Validation]](V&V).
== Locations ==
Its customer delivery centers were located in [[Pensacola, Florida]]; [[El Paso, Texas]]; [[Sterling, Virginia]], United States; [[Guadalajara]], Mexico; [[Mississauga]], Ontario, Canada; [[Stockholm]], Sweden; [[London]], UK; [[Ballarat]], Australia; [[Suzhou]], China; and [[Mumbai]], [[Bangalore]], [[Pune]], [[Chennai]], [[Hyderabad]], [[Noida]] and [[Gandhinagar]] in India. Its training and development facility, IGATE Corporate University, was in Pune.
Situated on {{convert|50|acre|m2}} of land in the Navi Mumbai area, this campus included facilities for software development, training, customer care, and employee recreation. The IGATE (Patni) Knowledge Park accommodates 17,000 professionals.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rediff.com/money/2004/apr/21patni.htm |title=Patni software park to seat 17,000 |publisher=Rediff.com |accessdate=16 July 2010}}</ref>
== Awards == * Ranked 51st in Fortune's100 Fastest Growing Companies list in 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://fortune.com/100-fastest-growing-companies/igate-51/|title=IGATE|work=Fortune}}</ref> * [[VCCircle]] Award 2014<ref>{{cite web|url=http://awards.vccircle.com/winners2014.html|title = Winners 2014|publisher=vccircle.com|accessdate=2015-04-28}}</ref> under the category - Best PE/VC backed IT Company of the Year 2013.
==References== {{reflist}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=November 2016}} {{Use New Zealand English|date=November 2016}} {{Infobox officeholder | image = James Gunson.jpg | honorific-prefix = | name = Sir James Gunson | honorific-suffix ={{post-nominals|country=NZL|CMG|CBE|size=100%}} | order = 24th [[Mayor of Auckland City]] | deputy = [[Andrew Entrican]] (1915-20)
Harold D. Heather (1920-22)
[[George Baildon]] (1922-25) | predecessor = [[James Parr (politician)|James Parr]] | successor = [[George Baildon]] | term_start = 1915 | term_end = 1925 | birth_date = 26 October 1877 | birth_place = [[Auckland]], [[New Zealand]] | death_date = {{death date and age|1963|05|12|1877|10|26|df=y}} | death_place = | spouse = Jessie Helen Wiseman | children = 3 | party = Reform | }} '''Sir James Henry Gunson''' {{post-nominals|country=NZL|CMG|CBE}} (26 October 1877 – 12 May 1963) was a New Zealand businessman and [[Mayor of Auckland City]] from 1915 to 1925. He was knighted in 1924. ==W Gunson & Co== Born and educated in Auckland, in his mid-twenties he took over W Gunson & Co, the seed-grain and produce business his father founded in 1881. William Gunson died in 1902. In October 1916, now mayor of Auckland, James sold his father's stock and station agency to [[Wright Stephenson]].Business Changes Hands. ''Auckland Star'', Volume XLVII, Issue 268, 9 November 1916, Page 8 ==Public life== James Gunson stood for Parliament several times without success; ([[Roskill (New Zealand electorate)|Roskill]] in 1919, [[Eden (New Zealand electorate)|Eden]] in 1926 and then [[Auckland Suburbs (New Zealand electorate)|Auckland Suburbs]] in 1928). ==Auckland== Mayor from 1915 to 1925 he undertook the building of the war memorials [[Auckland Museum]] and Cenotaph, the [[Domain Wintergardens|Wintergardens]] in [[Auckland Domain]] and the construction of [[Tamaki Drive]]. In later public life, he was responsible for the monument on One Tree Hill ([[Maungakiekie]]) and the treeplanting of [[Cornwall Park, Auckland|Cornwall Park]] fulfilling Sir [[John Logan Campbell (politician)|John Logan Campbell]]'s vision. Gunson was Chairman of the [[Auckland Harbour Board]] 1911–15, and was a member of the Government Railways Board 1931–35. Several parts of the city bear his name or were his gift. His farming property to the South of Auckland in [[Manukau]], called Totara Park, was later given to the city of Auckland. His main town residence, in St Andrew's Road, [[Epsom, New Zealand|Epsom]], became the Tongan royal residence, which it remains. A further Auckland property (named Rydal Mount after the residence of the English poet [[William Wordsworth]]) was by the same architect, Draffin, that Gunson had chosen to design [[Auckland Museum]]. Gunson Street, in Freemans Bay, Auckland, is named after him. In 1935, he was awarded the [[King George V Silver Jubilee Medal]].{{cite news | url=http://paperspast.natlib.govt.nz/cgi-bin/paperspast?a=d&cl=search&d=EP19350506.2.12 | title=Official jubilee medals | date=6 May 1935 | work= Evening Post | accessdate=14 August 2013 | page=4 }} ==Family== He married Jessie Helen Wiseman (later Lady Gunson {{post-nominals|post-noms=OBE}}) in 1905. They had three children; William, Geoffrey and Margaret. His brother Edward Burton Gunson {{post-nominals|post-noms=MD FRCP}} (1883–1950) practised as a cardiologist in Auckland 1919–37. During World War One while in the RAMC EB Gunson assisted Thomas Lewis, the noted clinical scientist, in achieving an improved understanding of the Effort Syndrome.The Soldier’s Heart and the Effort Syndrome. Thomas Lewis. London 1918. During World War Two Gunson worked for the Ministry of Supply in London publishing studies of women war workers' health.EB Gunson. British Medical Journal 1942 ii 753-5. Communal feeding. ==References== {{Reflist}} *''Who’s Who in New Zealand'', 4th edition 1941 *''Who's Who'' (UK/World edition), 1954 *[http://www.dnzb.govt.nz/DNZB/alt_essayBody.asp?essayID=3G25 Entry in ''Dictionary of New Zealand Biography''] {{S-start}} {{s-off}} {{S-bef | before = [[James Parr (politician)|James Parr]]}} {{s-ttl | title = [[Mayor of Auckland City]] | years=1915–1925}} {{s-aft | after = [[George Baildon]]}} {{End}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gunson, James}} [[Category:1877 births]] [[Category:1963 deaths]] [[Category:New Zealand stock and station agents]] [[Category:Mayors of Auckland]] [[Category:New Zealand businesspeople]] [[Category:New Zealand Reform Party politicians]] [[Category:Unsuccessful candidates in the New Zealand general election, 1919]] [[Category:Unsuccessful candidates in the New Zealand general election, 1928]] [[Category:New Zealand Companions of the Order of St Michael and St George]] [[Category:New Zealand Commanders of the Order of the British Empire]] [[Category:New Zealand Knights Bachelor]]

revision.text:
{{Orphan|date=March 2018}} {{Infobox academic |birth_date={{birth date and age|1961|05|15}} |birth_place=[[Paris]], [[France]] |alma_mater=[[HEC Montréal]] (1981)
[[McGill University]] (1986)
[[Harvard Graduate School of Business Administration]] (1993) |occupation=President (dean) of IMD business school }} '''Jean-François Manzoni''' (born 1961, Paris, France) is a French and Canadian academic and the President (Dean) and Nestlé Chaired Professor of [[International Institute for Management Development]] (IMD), an independent business school with a main campus located in Lausanne, Switzerland and an executive learning center in Singapore. == Early life == Manzoni was born in Paris, France on May 15, 1961. He immigrated to [[Canada]] in 1978. He graduated with a Bachelor of Business Administration in 1981 from the [[HEC Montréal|Ecole des Hautes Etudes Commerciales de Montréal]] and he earned an MBA in 1986 from [[McGill University]] in [[Montreal]]. In 1993 he graduated with a Doctorate in Business Administration from [[Harvard Graduate School of Business Administration]] in Boston.{{Cite web|url=https://www.imd.org/faculty/professors/jeanfrancois-manzoni/|title=Professor Jean-François Manzoni|website=IMD business school|language=en-US|access-date=2017-09-15}} == Career == He spent 12 years on [[INSEAD Business School]]'s Fontainebleau campus in France (1992–2004) during which he founded and directed the PwC Research Initiative on High Performance Organizations.{{Cite web|url=https://www.conference-board.org/search/google/?q=Jean+Francois+Manzoni|title=Search Results {{!}} The Conference Board|access-date=2017-09-15}} He spent seven years at the IMD business school (2004–2010), where he served as Professor of Leadership and Organizational Development and directed IMD’s Breakthrough Program for Senior Executives. He taught 5 years on INSEAD Business School's Singapore campus (2011–2016) during which he directed the school’s Global Leadership Centre.{{Cite news|url=https://www.insead.edu/events/jean-francois-manzoni|title=Event – Speaker – Jean-François Manzoni|date=2015-09-09|work=INSEAD|access-date=2017-09-15|language=en}} Manzoni assumed the role of president of [[International Institute for Management Development|IMD]] business school on 1 January 2017.{{Cite web|url=https://www.ft.com/content/aa501c44-11e2-11e6-839f-2922947098f0|title=IMD appoints Jean-François Manzoni as president|last=Moules|first=Jonathan|date=2016-05-04|website=Financial Times|access-date=2017-09-15}} Manzoni has co-authored several books and more than 30 business case studies on how leaders can create a high performance work environment reshaping management culture and unlearning bad practice. Four of his case studies were recognised in the Case of the Year Awards by the European Foundation for Management Development {{Cite web|url=https://www.efmd.org|title=EFMD – Business School Accreditation, Corporate Learning|website=www.efmd.org|language=en-gb|access-date=2017-09-15}} and the European Case centre.{{Cite web|url=https://www.thecasecentre.org/main/products/view?&id=62355|title=Helen Ramsay: A Mediation Attempt|website=thecasecentre.org|access-date=2017-09-15}} Manzoni has written several articles in the ''[[Harvard Business Review]]''{{Cite news|url=https://hbr.org/2016/09/to-get-more-feedback-act-more-coachable|title=To Get More Feedback, Act More Coachable|work=Harvard Business Review|access-date=2017-09-15}} and ''[[Financial Times]]''.{{Cite news|url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/0d117500-f17d-11d8-95b8-00000e2511c8.html?ft_site=falcon&desktop=true#axzz4shdwzg8O|title=How companies can go from good to great|last=Manzoni|first=Jean Francois|date=2004-08-19|work=Financial Times|access-date=2017-09-15|issn=0307-1766}} He is the author of ''The Set-Up to Fail Syndrome: How Good Managers Cause Great People to Fail'',{{Cite book|url=https://www.amazon.com/Set-Up-Fail-Syndrome-Managers-People/dp/0875849490|title=The Set-Up-To-Fail Syndrome: How Good Managers Cause Great People to Fail|last=Manzoni|first=Jean-Francois|last2=Barsoux|first2=Jean-Louis|date=October 2002|publisher=Harvard Business Review Press|isbn=9780875849492|location=Boston, Mass|language=English}} which he co authored with Jean-Louis Barsoux. The book expands on an similarly themed article{{Cite news|url=https://hbr.org/1998/03/the-set-up-to-fail-syndrome|title=The Set-Up-To-Fail Syndrome|work=Harvard Business Review|access-date=2017-09-15}} in ''The Harvard Business Review'' in which the authors explored how managers’ behavior might contribute to employees poor performance. In an interview with [[BBC News|BBC]], Manzoni explained how employees also contribute to their own unsatisfactory relationships with their superiors. Manzoni cautioned that attaching labels like demanding or overbearing can ultimately become a self-fulfilling prophecy. "The moment you label someone as difficult you’ve just made them more difficult to work with because you’re not going to give this person the benefit of the doubt anymore and you’re not going to relate with them on a productive level."{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbc.com/capital/story/20170817-how-to-identify-and-handle-a-demanding-boss|title=How to identify, and handle, a demanding boss|last=Johanson|first=Mark|access-date=2017-09-15}} Manzoni was invited to speak at the 2014 and 2016 [[World Economic Forum]] meetings in Davos.{{Cite web|url=https://www.speakersassociates.com/speaker/jean-francois-manzoni|title=Jean-Francois Manzoni|last=Ltd|first=Speakers Associates|date=2016-11-04|website=Speakers Associates|language=en-UK|access-date=2017-09-15}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.weforum.org/people/jean-francois-manzoni/|title=Jean-François Manzoni {{!}} World Economic Forum|website=World Economic Forum|access-date=2017-09-15}} Manzoni is a member of the Human Capital Leadership Institute’s International Advisory Panel,{{Cite web|url=http://www.hcli.org/the-institute/international-academic-panel/|title=international academic panel – Human Capital Leadership Institute|website=www.hcli.org|language=en-US|access-date=2017-09-15}} Digital Switzerland, Singapore’s Public Service Division and the [[Russian Presidential Academy of National Economy and Public Administration]]. == Personal life == Manzoni currently resides in Lausanne, Switzerland where he moved from Singapore in 2016 to join IMD as a Professor of Leadership & Organisational Development. == References == {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Manzoni, Jean François}} [[Category:1961 births]] [[Category:Academics]] [[Category:French expatriates in Canada]] [[Category:French expatriates in Singapore]] [[Category:French expatriates in Switzerland]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Singaporean academics]] [[Category:Swiss academics]] [[Category:Business schools]]

{{Infobox person | name = Joel Simkhai | image = File:Joel Simkhai at TechCrunch Disrupt SF 2012.jpg | alt = Joel Simkhai at [[TechCrunch]] Disrupt SF 2012 | caption = Simkhai at [[TechCrunch]] Disrupt SF 2012 | birth_name = | birth_date = <!-- {{birth date and age|YYYY|MM|DD}} for living people supply only the year with {{Birth year and age|YYYY}} unless the exact date is already widely published, as per [[WP:DOB]]. For people who have died, use {{Birth date|YYYY|MM|DD}}. --> | birth_place = [[Tel Aviv]], [[Israel]] | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = | other_names = | occupation = | years_active = | known_for = founder and former CEO of [[Grindr]] and [[Blendr]] | notable_works = }}
'''Joel Simkhai''' (born c. 1979<ref name=Haaretz /> in Tel Aviv, Israel<ref>{{cite web |url=http://fortune.com/2014/08/12/10-questions-joel-simkhai-founder-and-ceo-grindr/ |title=10 Questions: Joel Simkhai, founder and CEO, Grindr |author=Chanelle Bessette |date=August 12, 2014 |publisher=''[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]]'' |accessdate=July 1, 2017}}</ref>) is the founder and former CEO of [[geosocial networking]] and dating apps [[Grindr]]<ref name=SexEd>{{cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/12/14/fashion/the-sex-education-of-grindrs-joel-simkhai.html |title=The Sex Education of Grindr's Joel Simkhai |publisher=''[[The New York Times]]'' |author=Guy Trebay |date=December 12, 2014 |accessdate=July 1, 2017}}</ref> and [[Blendr]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nbclosangeles.com/news/tech/A-New-Dating-Blendr-129452388.html |title=A New Social Blendr |author=Mekahlo Medina |date=September 8, 2011 |publisher=[[NBC Los Angeles]]}}</ref> His original goal in starting Grindr was for people with similar interests to find new friends nearby.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://venturebeat.com/2012/03/14/grindr-creator-on-his-new-app-lesbian-gaydar-more-at-sxsw-video/ |title=Grindr creator on his new app, lesbian gaydar, & more at SXSW [video] |author=J. O'Dell |date=March 14, 2012 |publisher=[[VentureBeat]] |accessdate=July 1, 2017}}</ref>
== Life and career == Simkhai was born in Tel Aviv, Israel. His mother sold jewelry and his father was a diamond-dealer. When he was three years old, his family moved to New York City.<ref name=Haaretz>{{cite web |url=http://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/culture/1.601218 |title=Israeli Founder of Grindr Talks About Growing Up Gay and Coming Out to His Family |author=Doron Halutz |date=June 28, 2016 |publisher=''[[Haaretz]]'' |accessdate=July 1, 2017}}</ref> He received his [[bachelor of arts]] degree in International Relations & Economics from [[Tufts University]] in May 1998.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.crunchbase.com/person/joel-simkhai#/entity |title=Joel Simkhai - Founder & Chief Executive Officer @ Grindr |publisher=[[crunchbase]] |accessdate=July 1, 2017}}</ref> After starting college, he [[Coming out|came out]] to himself and his parents. While his father accepted the news immediately, his mother took more time, but is now proud of her son and how famous he has become.<ref name=Haaretz />
While he started with little money or expertise<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thedrum.com/news/2016/05/25/grindr-ceo-joel-simkhai-explains-how-he-turned-his-idea-app-reality |title=Grindr CEO Joel Simkhai explains how he turned his idea for the app into a reality |author=Minda Smiley |date=May 25, 2016 |website=thedrum.com |accessdate=July 1, 2017}}</ref> and never expected Grindr to become international,<ref name=Haaretz /> he is now a multimillionaire CEO of an app with millions of users worldwide.<ref name=SexEd />
Simkhai is a charter member of the [[Young Presidents' Organization]].<ref name=SexEd />
== References == {{reflist|30em}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Simkhai, Joel}} [[Category:1970s births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Gay men]] [[Category:LGBT businesspeople]] [[Category:LGBT people from Israel]] [[Category:LGBT Jews]] [[Category:People from Tel Aviv]] [[Category:Tufts University alumni]] [[Category:Israeli businesspeople]]

{{Infobox television | show_name = Kourtney and Kim Take New York |image = KourtneyandKimTakeNewYorkLogo.jpg |genre = [[Reality television|Reality]] | creator = | starring = {{Plainlist| * [[Kourtney Kardashian]] * [[Kim Kardashian]] }} | theme_music_composer = | opentheme = "[[I'm in Miami Bitch#Alternate versions|I'm in New York Trick]]" by [[LMFAO]] | country = United States | language = English | num_seasons = 2 | num_episodes = 20 | executive_producer = {{Plainlist| * Ryan Seacrest * Jonathan Murray * Jeff Jenkins * Gil Goldschein * Russell Jay * Melissa Bidwell * Kris Jenner }} | camera = [[Single-camera setup|Single]] | runtime = {{Plainlist| * 23 minutes
{{small|(Season 1)}} * 42 minutes
{{small|(Season 2)}} }} | company = {{Plainlist| * [[Bunim/Murray Productions]] * [[Ryan Seacrest Productions]] }} | network = [[E!]] | picture_format = [[480i]] ([[Standard-definition television|SDTV]])
[[1080i]] ([[High-definition television|HDTV]]) | first_aired = {{Start date|2011|01|23}} | last_aired = {{End date|2012|01|29}} | followed_by = ''[[Kourtney and Kim Take Miami]]'' | related = ''[[Keeping Up with the Kardashians]]'' }} '''''Kourtney and Kim Take New York''''' is an American [[reality television]] series that premiered January 23, 2011, on [[E!]] and ran for two seasons. It follows sisters [[Kourtney Kardashian|Kourtney]] and [[Kim Kardashian]] as they open a [[Dash (boutique)|Dash]] boutique in [[New York City]].{{cite web|last=Serpe|first=Gina|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/203757/look-out-new-york-here-comes-e-s-new-kardashian-show|title=Look Out, New York: Here Comes E!'s New Kardashian Show|publisher=E! News|accessdate=December 2, 2012}} ''Kourtney and Kim Take New York'' is the second [[Spin-off (media)|spin-off]] of ''[[Keeping Up with the Kardashians]]''. ==Premise== ''Kourtney and Kim Take New York'' follows [[Kourtney Kardashian]] as she leaves Los Angeles once more, this time followed by younger sister [[Kim Kardashian|Kim]], to open a third [[Dash (boutique)|Dash]] retail store, in [[New York City]]. Kim and Kourtney started shooting a second season in August 2011.{{cite web|title=Kim & Kourtney Kardashian Begin Season 2 Filming|url=http://celebrity-gossip.net/kourtney-kim-take-new-york/kim-kourtney-kardashian-begin-season-2-filming-538193|work=Gossip Center|accessdate=September 8, 2013|date=August 30, 2011}} On October 26, 2011, E! announced that the series had been renewed for a second season. The second season was filmed following Kim's marriage to basketball player [[Kris Humphries]] that month. However, the season was reworked to focus more on the couple's troubles after Kardashian filed for divorce in October 2011.{{cite web|title=E!'s "Kourtney & Kim Take New York," "After Lately" to Return Sunday, November 27; "The Soup" Moves to Wednesdays Beginning November 30|url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/news/2011/10/26/es-kourtney-and-kim-take-new-york-after-lately-to-return-sunday-november-27-the-soup-moves-to-wednesdays-beginning-november-30-994100/20111026e01/|accessdate=December 2, 2012}} The second season premiered on November 27, 2011, and the premiere episode acquired 3.1 million viewers.{{cite web|last=Seidman|first=Robert|title=E!'s 'Kourtney & Kim Take New York' Draws 3.2 Million Viewers and is Show's Most-Watched Season Premiere Ever|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/11/28/es-kourtney-kim-take-new-york-draws-3-2-million-viewers-and-is-shows-most-watched-season-premiere-ever/111939/|work=TV by the Numbers|date=November 28, 2011}} ==Cast== ===Main=== * [[Kourtney Kardashian]] * [[Kim Kardashian]] * [[Scott Disick]] ===Supporting=== * [[Khloé Kardashian]] (seasons 1–2) * [[Kris Jenner]] (seasons 1–2) * Mason Disick (season 2), Kourtney and Scott's son. * [[Kris Humphries]] (season 2), Kim's then husband, now ex-husband. * [[Jonathan Cheban]] (season 2), Kim's best friend ==Episodes== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! colspan="2" rowspan="2" |Season ! rowspan="2" |Episodes ! colspan="2" |Originally aired |- ! First aired ! Last aired |- | bgcolor="#2daada" | | [[#Season 1 (2011)|1]] | 10 | January 23, 2011 | April 3, 2011 |- | bgcolor="#ae0057" | | [[#Season 2 (2011–12)|2]] | 10 | November 27, 2011 | January 29, 2012 |} ===Season 1 (2011)=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="background-color: #2daada; color: #000000;" width=7% | No. in

(million) |- {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 1 |EpisodeNumber2 = 1 |Title = Life in the Big City |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|01|23}} |ShortSummary = Kourtney and Kim arrive in New York City in hopes of achieving success with the opening of their new store, DASH New York. Kourtney considers asking her boyfriend Scott to move into her hotel suite, which annoys Kim who had planned on spending most of her time with her sister. Also, newly single Kim tries to mingle with eligible New Yorkers but when the media sees Kim out on innocent dates, they twist the story into something that it's not, upsetting Kim. |Viewers = 3.01{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/01/25/sunday-cable-ratings-real-housewives-kardashians-hollys-world-lead-night-shameless-much-more/80129|title=Sunday Cable Ratings: 'Real Housewives,' Kardashians, 'Holly's World' Lead Night + 'Shameless' & Much More|last=Seidman|first=Robert|publisher=TV by the Numbers|date=January 25, 2011}} |LineColor = 2daada }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 2 |EpisodeNumber2 = 2 |Title = Start Spreading the News |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|01|30}} |ShortSummary = Scott gets into a fight at New York's Juliet supper club with a man after his girlfriend started arguing with Kim, resulting in Kourtney not speaking to Scott, whom she believes started the fight. Meanwhile, Khloè comes to New York City to visit Kourtney and Kim. |Viewers = 3.17{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/02/01/sunday-cable-ratings-hollys-world-real-housewives-finale-up-plus-kardashians-shameless-much-more/81033|title=Sunday Cable Ratings: 'Holly's World,' 'Real Housewives' Finale Up; Plus 'Kardashians,' 'Shameless' & Much More|last=Gorman|first=Bill|publisher=TV by the Numbers|date=February 1, 2011}} |LineColor = 2daada }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 3 |EpisodeNumber2 = 3 |Title = Sexy in the City |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|02|13}} |ShortSummary = Kourtney fears Kim is heading too fast toward love with her former bodyguard. Meanwhile, Scott wonders if he can maintain his sobriety. |Viewers = 2.18{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/02/23/sunday-cable-ratings-nba-all-stars-housewives-worst-cooks-and-kardashians-lead-night-shameless-more/83553|title=Sunday Cable Ratings: NBA All Stars, Housewives, Worst Cooks and Kardashians Lead Night + 'Shameless' & More|last=Seidman|first=Robert|publisher=TV by the Numbers|date=February 23, 2011}} |LineColor = 2daada }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 5 |EpisodeNumber2 = 5 |Title = Down and Out in New York City |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|02|21}} |ShortSummary = Kim is devastated to learn Shengo's visa is expiring and wonders if there's a way to keep her Aussie in the country. Meanwhile, Kourtney and Scott struggle to find privacy. |Viewers = N/A |LineColor = 2daada }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 6 |EpisodeNumber2 = 6 |Title = Dream A Little Dream |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|03|06}} |ShortSummary = Kim receives an unexpected offer to record a single with music superstar The Dream but her nerves force her to reconsider. Meanwhile, Scott purchases a walking stick that annoys Kourtney. |Viewers = 1.99{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/03/08/sunday-cable-ratings-tosh-leads-night-more-breakout-kings-shameless-up-much-more/85034|title=Sunday Cable Ratings: Tosh Leads Night + More 'Breakout Kings;' 'Shameless' Up & MUCH More|last=Seidman|first=Robert|publisher=TV by the Numbers|date=March 8, 2011}} |LineColor = 2daada }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 7 |EpisodeNumber2 = 7 |Title = Straight Expectations |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|03|13}} |ShortSummary = Kourtney tries to prove to Kim that her new shopping buddy isn't who she thinks he is. Scott and Kourtney have an explosive argument leading them to question if they can live together. |Viewers = 2.07{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/03/15/sunday-cable-ratings-chopped-rises-leads-night-breakout-kings-army-wives-down-much-more/85829|title=Sunday Cable Ratings: 'Chopped' Rises, Leads Night; 'Breakout Kings;' 'Army Wives' Down & MUCH More|last=Gorman|first=Bill|publisher=TV by the Numbers|date=March 15, 2011}} |LineColor = 2daada }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 8 |EpisodeNumber2 = 8 |Title = A Dash of Respect |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|03|20}} |ShortSummary = Khloé returns to NY for DASH's grand opening, leaving Kim hurt and jealous when Kourtney and Khloe bond. Scott lands a magazine cover and hires an assistant to help with his busy schedule but he may act a little too bossy. |Viewers = 2.07 |LineColor = 2daada }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 9 |EpisodeNumber2 = 9 |Title = In a New York Minute |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|03|27}} |ShortSummary = Kourtney gets the opportunity of a lifetime when she's offered a role on ''[[One Life to Live]]''. Kim must decide between attending Scott's work event or obeying her mother's commands. |Viewers = 2.10{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/03/29/sunday-cable-ratings-army-wives-takes-the-crown-breakout-kings-rises-shameless-finale-steady-much-more/87543|title=Sunday Cable Ratings: 'Army Wives' Takes The Crown; 'Breakout Kings,' Rises; 'Shameless' Finale Steady + Much More|last=Gorman|first=Bill|publisher=TV by the Numbers|date=March 29, 2011}} |LineColor = 2daada }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 10 |EpisodeNumber2 = 10 |Title = One Last Dash |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|04|03}} |ShortSummary = Kim's torn about leaving NYC and debates making a drastic cross-country move. Kourtney and Scott celebrate their relationship with a night out and Scott considers popping the question. |Viewers = 2.07{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/04/05/sunday-cable-ratings-army-wives-kardashians-lead-night-the-killing-the-borgias-breakout-kings-much-more/88403|title=Sunday Cable Ratings: 'Army Wives,' Kardashians Lead Night; + 'The Killing,' 'The Borgias,' 'Breakout Kings + Much More|last=Gorman|first=Bill|publisher=TV by the Numbers|date=April 5, 2011}} |LineColor = 2daada }} |} ===Season 2 (2011–12)=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="background-color: #AE0057; color: #000000;" width=7% | No. in

(million) |- {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 11 |EpisodeNumber2 = 1 |Title = The Honeymoon is Over |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|11|27}} |ShortSummary = The second season begins with newlyweds Kim and Kris living with Kourtney and Scott, but things don't go exactly as planned. Kourtney and Scott continue to clash and Scott eventually goes to his friend, Jonathan Cheban, to get some space. Kris also acts up during an event with Kim because it interferes with his training schedule. Kris also struggles dealing with Kourtney and Mason, as well as living with Kim. After he walks in on Kourtney, Kim and some friends taking a [[naked yoga]] class inside their apartment, Kris gets furious at Kim after seeing a [[Clothed female, nude male|naked yoga instructor]]. He then decides to go to Minnesota and train in his element. |Viewers = 3.19{{Cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/11/29/sunday-cable-ratings-the-walking-dead-goes-out-on-top-kardashians-housewives-soul-train-awards-hell-on-wheels-boardwalk-empire-homeland-dexter-more/112136/|title=Sunday Cable Ratings: 'The Walking Dead' Goes Out on Top + Kardashians, 'Housewives' 'Soul Train Awards,' 'Hell On Wheels,' 'Boardwalk Empire,' 'Homeland,' 'Dexter' & More|publisher=TV by the Numbers|last=Seidman|first=Robert|date=November 29, 2011}} |LineColor = AE0057 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 12 |EpisodeNumber2 = 2 |Title = Go Get Your Man |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|12|4}} |ShortSummary = Khloe visits the city to help Kim and Kourtney deal with their man problems. She sends Kim to Minnesota to persuade Kris to come back to New York, but she lashes out at Khloe over waking her up an hour earlier than she should have and ends up hurting Khloe's feelings. Kourtney, Khloe and Mason go to Scott's parents' house in the Hamptons, where Kourtney continues to wreak havoc with her uber-cleanliness and she offends Scott's mother when she throws away vintage items. Kourtney and Scott eventually make up and Kris finally agrees to come back to New York with Kim after she continuously nags him to compromise. |Viewers = 2.99{{cite web|last=Gorman|first=Bill|title=Sunday Cable Ratings: Kourtney & Kim Top The Night + 'Housewives Atlanta,' 'Hell On Wheels,' 'Boardwalk Empire,' 'Homeland,' 'Dexter' & More|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/12/06/sunday-cable-ratings-kourtney-kim-top-the-night-housewives-atlanta-hell-on-wheels-boardwalk-empire-homeland-dexter-more/112769/|work=TV by the Numbers|date=December 6, 2011}} |LineColor = AE0057 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 13 |EpisodeNumber2 = 3 |Title = Three's a Crowd |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|12|11}} |ShortSummary = Kim decides to get off of birth control and decides to ask Kris Humphries if it's time to have a baby. Meanwhile, Kris Jenner visits the girls in NYC and hosts the Today show with Scott. However, after serious consideration, Kim decides not to have a baby at this moment despite Kris Humpries wanting to start a family after talking to Scott. |Viewers = 3.21{{cite web|last=Seidman|first=Robert|title=Sunday Cable Ratings: Kourtney & Kim Top 'Housewives Atlanta' + ' 'Boardwalk Empire,' 'Bag of Bones,' 'Homeland,' 'Dexter' & More|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/12/13/sunday-cable-ratings-kourtney-kim-top-housewives-atlanta-boardwalk-empire-bag-of-bones-homeland-dexter-more/113485/|work=TV by the Numbers|date=December 13, 2011}} |LineColor = AE0057 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 14 |EpisodeNumber2 = 4 |Title = True Colors |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|12|18}} |ShortSummary = Kim feels betrayed when Jonathan writes a tell all book about her which results in a fight. But after reading an unofficial copy of the book, she realizes that it wasn't a tell all book, but instead a book about how to make it as a "it girl" and referring to Kim as a successful and extraordinary person. Meanwhile Kris throws a house party behind Kim and Kourtney's back while they are in California promoting their Kardashian Kollection with [[Khloé Kardashian]]. Being against it from the start, Scott takes the blame for the party when the girls find out after seeing pictures taken from the party. Meanwhile, Scott tries to get in touch with his Jewish roots after realizing that Kourtney wants to raise Mason as a Christian. Despite Kourtney's doubts that Scott is taking his religion seriously, she finally agrees to support him. |Viewers = 2.84{{cite web|last=Gorman|first=Bill|title=Sunday Cable Ratings: 'Housewives Atlanta' Top 'Kourtney & Kim' + 'Dexter,' 'Homeland,' 'Iron Chef,' 'Real Deal' Finales & More|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/12/20/sunday-cable-ratings-housewives-atlanta-top-kourtney-kim-dexter-homeland-iron-chef-real-deal-finales-more/114215/|work=TV by the Numbers|date=December 20, 2011}} |LineColor = AE0057 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 15 |EpisodeNumber2 = 5 |Title = Questionable Actions |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2012|01|01}} |ShortSummary = Kris Humphries ruffles feathers with Kim & Jonathan when he questions Jonathan's sexuality. Kourtney takes a surprising interest in coupons and Scott makes his biggest impulse buy yet, but takes it way too far. |Viewers = 2.82[http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2012/01/04/sunday-cable-ratings-kourtney-kim-take-new-years-mob-wives-2-rachael-vs-guy-leverage-more/115226/ Sunday Cable Ratings: ‘Kourtney & Kim’ Take New Year’s + ‘Mob Wives 2,’ ‘Rachael vs. Guy,’ ‘Leverage’ & More - Ratings | TVbytheNumbers] |LineColor = AE0057 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 16 |EpisodeNumber2 = 6 |Title = Cat's Away Mice Play |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2012|01|08}} |ShortSummary = Kourtney, Kim and Mason visit [[Connecticut]] while Kris and Scott sneak to Toronto for Kris' appearance at a party. This makes Kim unhappy when she finds out on the internet and wonders if she can trust him. |Viewers = 3.27{{cite web|last=Seidman|first=Robert|title=Sunday Cable Ratings: Kardashians Rule, Oprah Drools? + Atlanta 'Housewives,' 'Cajun Pawn Stars,' 'Mob Wives 2,' 'Rachael vs. Guy,' 'Leverage,' 'Shameless' & More|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2012/01/10/sunday-cable-ratings-kardashians-rule-oprah-drools-atlanta-housewives-cajun-pawn-stars-mob-wives-2-rachael-vs-guy-leverage-shameless-more/115904/|work=TV by the Numbers|date=January 10, 2012}} |LineColor = AE0057 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 17 |EpisodeNumber2 = 7 |Title = Kim Takes Dubai |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2012|01|08}} |ShortSummary = Kim travels to Dubai with her mom and realizes she's having a great time without her husband. Back in New York, Kourtney and Khloe play a prank on Kris Humphries, who ends up finding it annoying. |Viewers = 3.30 |LineColor = AE0057 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 18 |EpisodeNumber2 = 8 |Title = Family Therapy |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2012|01|15}} |ShortSummary = Kim takes her frustration with her husband out on her sisters and Scott. Khloe tries to help Kourtney and Scott get back in the same bedroom, and Kim eventually apologizes to Khloe about the email she sent her. |Viewers = 3.27{{cite web|last=Gorman|first=Bill|title=Sunday Cable Ratings: 'Kourtney & Kim' Take The Crown + 'Cajun Pawn Stars, Atlanta 'Housewives,' 'Mob Wives 2,' 'Hell On Wheels' 'Leverage,' 'Shameless' & More|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2012/01/18/sunday-cable-ratings-kourtney-kim-take-the-crown-cajun-pawn-stars-atlanta-housewives-mob-wives-2-hell-on-wheels-leverage-shameless-more/116803/|work=TV by the Numbers|date=January 18, 2012}} |LineColor = AE0057 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 19 |EpisodeNumber2 = 9 |Title = Voices From Beyond |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2012|01|22}} |ShortSummary = Kim sees a medium to communicate with her [[Robert Kardashian|late father]]. Kris' sister arrives in town. |Viewers = 2.94{{cite web|last=Seidman|first=Robert|title=Sunday Cable Ratings: 'Kourtney & Kim' Edge Down, Still Lead + Atlanta 'Housewives,' 'Ax Men, 'Mob Wives 2,' 'Shameless' & More|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2012/01/24/sunday-cable-ratings-kourtney-kim-edge-down-still-lead-atlanta-housewives-ax-men-mob-wives-2-shameless-more/117326/|work=TV by the Numbers|date=January 24, 2012}} |LineColor = AE0057 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 20 |EpisodeNumber2 = 10 |Title = Goodbye, New York |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2012|01|29}} |ShortSummary = Kim comes to a conclusion about her marriage as the gang prepares to leave New York City. |Viewers = 4.47{{cite web|last=Gorman|first=Bill|title=Sunday Cable Ratings: 'Kourtney & Kim' Finale Goes Large + Atlanta 'Housewives,' 'Ax Men, 'Mob Wives 2,' 'Shameless' & More|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2012/01/31/sunday-cable-ratings-kourtney-kim-finale-goes-large-atlanta-housewives-ax-men-mob-wives-2-shameless-more/118082/|work=TV by the Numbers|date=January 31, 2012}} |LineColor = AE0057 }} |} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} == External links == * {{IMDb title|1821879}} * {{TV Guide|308707}} {{E!|state=collapsed}} {{The Kardashian Family|state=collapsed}} [[Category:2010s American television series]] [[Category:2011 American television series debuts]] [[Category:2012 American television series endings]] [[Category:English-language television programs]] [[Category:Television series by Bunim/Murray Productions]] [[Category:Television series by Ryan Seacrest Productions]] [[Category:Television shows set in New York City]] [[Category:Keeping Up with the Kardashians]] [[Category:Reality television spin-offs]] [[Category:Kardashian family]] [[Category:E! network shows]] [[Category:Kim Kardashian]]
